revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-16 16:05:08.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/ceph/lib/facter/ceph_osd.rb'], 'message': 'Fix mock nbd block devices

NBD client creates a number of empty devices like /dev/nbd0..15
To fix the issue, before processing a partition script checks if
that partition was present in lsblk output.

Change-Id: I118c36a78e4661f82d4c11209ca98dca0fb2716a
Closes-Bug: #1510851
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mock nbd block devices

NBD client creates a number of empty devices like /dev/nbd0..15
To fix the issue, before processing a partition script checks if
that partition was present in lsblk output.

Change-Id: I118c36a78e4661f82d4c11209ca98dca0fb2716a
Closes-Bug: #1510851

subject: Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-16 00:54:40.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically

Change-Id: I4f650eaa07624b889a52570e628a21e905f2bd46"}]
commit_message:
Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically

Change-Id: I4f650eaa07624b889a52570e628a21e905f2bd46

commit_message:
Enabling DeprecationWarning if session is not provided

DeprecationWarning is ignored by default. Enable it so
that the deprecation message is displayed.

Change-Id: I40bfc82555d757eaba237b638bcd2753417f14f6
Closes-bug: #1515967

subject: Added new projects for the OSA role break out
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-11-12 08:32:23.000000000', 'files': ['gerritbot/channels.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Added new projects for the OSA role break out

The change adds new projects for the roles within OpenStack-Ansible
This is the first batch for the break out work which encompases the
OpenStack-Ansible play `setup-hosts.yml`.

New projects:
    - openstack-ansible-security
    - openstack-ansible-specs
    - openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create
    - openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts
    - openstack-ansible-py_from_git
    - openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts
    - openstack-ansible-pip_install
    - openstack-ansible-rsyslog_client
    - openstack-ansible-apt_package_pinning

The related review for the governance repository is
https://review.openstack.org/244166

Implements: blueprint independent-role-repositories
Change-Id: Ibfd5e745b7c5836b1c421b06ff8ef1e122c14108
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>'}]
commit_message:
Added new projects for the OSA role break out

The change adds new projects for the roles within OpenStack-Ansible
This is the first batch for the break out work which encompases the
OpenStack-Ansible play `setup-hosts.yml`.

New projects:
    - openstack-ansible-security
    - openstack-ansible-specs
    - openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create
    - openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts
    - openstack-ansible-py_from_git
    - openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts
    - openstack-ansible-pip_install
    - openstack-ansible-rsyslog_client
    - openstack-ansible-apt_package_pinning

The related review for the governance repository is
https://review.openstack.org/244166

Implements: blueprint independent-role-repositories
Change-Id: Ibfd5e745b7c5836b1c421b06ff8ef1e122c14108
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7468, 'name': 'Sergey Vasilenko', 'email': 'svasilenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'xenolog'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 13948, 'name': 'Bartłomiej Piotrowski', 'email': 'bpiotrowski@mirantis.com', 'username': 'bpiotrowski'}, {'_account_id': 14316, 'name': 'Peter Zhurba', 'email': 'peter.zhurba@gmail.com', 'username': 'pzhurba'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-16 11:22:23.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ns_haproxy'], 'message': "Block new connections in HAProxy netns for its reload time

And unblock after the reload operation finished.

This introduces a 1 second latency lag to new
TCP connections requests made in the middle of the
HAProxy reload operation (which takes normally ~20 ms).
Otherwise, those would likely be aborted with RST,
which is much worse than a 1 second lag.
Note, that the scope of the blocking rule is limited to the
HAProxy network namespace and doesn't affect other connections.

Closes-bug: #1510236

Change-Id: Ic33f7539421fd3a8306e72d2a0b1519d94263380
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
Co-author: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Block new connections in HAProxy netns for its reload time

And unblock after the reload operation finished.

This introduces a 1 second latency lag to new
TCP connections requests made in the middle of the
HAProxy reload operation (which takes normally ~20 ms).
Otherwise, those would likely be aborted with RST,
which is much worse than a 1 second lag.
Note, that the scope of the blocking rule is limited to the
HAProxy network namespace and doesn't affect other connections.

Closes-bug: #1510236

Change-Id: Ic33f7539421fd3a8306e72d2a0b1519d94263380
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
Co-author: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix return value for get_supervisor_pid

In bash, you cannot use return to return a string value so this change
fixes it so the get_supervisor_pid function echos the PID which is
captured where it is called to be checked.

Change-Id: I6fe71a977ca75d58cf87fef819ee8e74d6edfcdd
Closes-Bug: #1514798

subject: cleanup tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-16 00:43:28.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "cleanup tox.ini

* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically

Change-Id: I334c8db354f212f3f990f3ba59f2aa46355dae74"}]
commit_message:
cleanup tox.ini

* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically

Change-Id: I334c8db354f212f3f990f3ba59f2aa46355dae74

commit_message:
Lodgeit: Downgrade gate and check jobs to experimental

Enabling the pep8 and py27 gate/check jobs, before merging the
changes that fix the pep8 warnings and make the tests work, makes
Jenkins score Verified-2 on changes.

Downgrade the jobs to experimental.

Change-Id: I53935f50e0fadcb92a6b5472012515411f4cd933

subject: avoid unnecessary inner join in get_resources() for SQL backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-09 07:08:02.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'avoid unnecessary inner join in get_resources() for SQL backend

To get distinct resource ids, we do a query on resource table which
inner join sample table, and apply filters on it.

Note that when sql_expire_samples_only is enabled, there will be
some resources without any sample, in such case we must use inner
join to avoid wrong result, no matter if there is a timestamp filter
or not.

But that option is disabled by default, so when there is no timestamp
filters, the inner join is unnecessary, we should avoid it to save
some RAM/CPU cost.

Change-Id: If85dbea15d42d42c6b0be7402c06f258e278b2eb
Closes-Bug: #1509677
(cherry picked from commit a4f442940551a8a38e26e132c7efa766226daa15)
'}]
commit_message:
avoid unnecessary inner join in get_resources() for SQL backend

To get distinct resource ids, we do a query on resource table which
inner join sample table, and apply filters on it.

Note that when sql_expire_samples_only is enabled, there will be
some resources without any sample, in such case we must use inner
join to avoid wrong result, no matter if there is a timestamp filter
or not.

But that option is disabled by default, so when there is no timestamp
filters, the inner join is unnecessary, we should avoid it to save
some RAM/CPU cost.

Change-Id: If85dbea15d42d42c6b0be7402c06f258e278b2eb
Closes-Bug: #1509677
(cherry picked from commit a4f442940551a8a38e26e132c7efa766226daa15)

blueprint support-host-aggregate

revisions: [{'number': 20, 'created': '2015-11-16 22:45:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/themes/default/horizon/_styles.scss', 'horizon/static/auth/login/login.websso.mock.html', 'horizon/templates/auth/_login.html', 'horizon/static/auth/login/login.spec.js', 'horizon/templates/auth/_login_page.html', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/_util.scss', 'horizon/static/auth/login/login-finder.directive.js', 'horizon/templates/auth/_description.html', 'horizon/templates/horizon/common/_form_field.html', 'horizon/templates/horizon/common/_region_selector.html', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/default/bootstrap/components/_panels.scss', 'horizon/templates/auth/_login_modal.html', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/_splash.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/pages/loginpage.py', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/components/_login.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/horizon.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/default/bootstrap/_variables.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/default/bootstrap/_styles.scss', 'horizon/templates/auth/_login_form.html', 'horizon/static/auth/login/login.regular.mock.html', 'doc/source/topics/customizing.rst'], 'message': "Horizon Login now inherits from Bootstrap Theme The Horizon login page was not properly inheriting its styles from its theme. The implementation was making use of the _modal_form.html template just to inherit a form, but there was no way to remove the modal classes with that implementation. The login page now uses a standard Bootstrap 'panel'. This will inherit the look and feel of any theme more naturally when its not inside of a modal, as not all themes use box-shadow outside of a modal; some chose to be very flat on purpose, and the built in panels take advantage of this. When used within the Region selector, it does need to exist within a modal, so some simple logic was added for the classes necessary. The panel is a little bit wider than it was before, but it is now a standard Bootstrap column size, so its responsive down to a very small screen size. The modal is a little bit wider than it was before as well, as it is is now the standard medium modal size for Bootstrap. Improvements: * Logo is now an tag, which means it can automagically resize to fit in the available space * Unneccesary styles removed * _splash.scss was only being used in _login.html, which was confusing, so _splash.scss is renamed to _login.scss, and is now a class based style, so it can live in /components * Its now Theme ready and responsive * Region Selector Login now has a proper modal backdrop * has-error help-text should not be alert alert-danger Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards Change-Id: Ie968414ab8ef2154623edfc21ce5623e8c4057c6 "}]
commit_message: Horizon Login now inherits from Bootstrap Theme The Horizon login page was not properly inheriting its styles from its theme. The implementation was making use of the _modal_form.html template just to inherit a form, but there was no way to remove the modal classes with that implementation. The login page now uses a standard Bootstrap 'panel'. This will inherit the look and feel of any theme more naturally when its not inside of a modal, as not all themes use box-shadow outside of a modal; some chose to be very flat on purpose, and the built in panels take advantage of this. When used within the Region selector, it does need to exist within a modal, so some simple logic was added for the classes necessary. The panel is a little bit wider than it was before, but it is now a standard Bootstrap column size, so its responsive down to a very small screen size. The modal is a little bit wider than it was before as well, as it is is now the standard medium modal size for Bootstrap. Improvements: * Logo is now an tag, which means it can automagically resize to fit in the available space * Unneccesary styles removed * _splash.scss was only being used in _login.html, which was confusing, so _splash.scss is renamed to _login.scss, and is now a class based style, so it can live in /components * Its now Theme ready and responsive * Region Selector Login now has a proper modal backdrop * has-error help-text should not be alert alert-danger Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards Change-Id: Ie968414ab8ef2154623edfc21ce5623e8c4057c6

commit_message:
Add transaction for setting agent_id in L3HARouterAgentPortBinding

To avoid having extra L3HARouterAgentPortBinding with l3_agent as
None, operation of setting l3_agent should be atomic.
For this purpose, transaction was added in methods
create_ha_port_and_bind and _bind_ha_router_to_agents.

Closes-Bug: #1499647

Change-Id: Iaad82fe522cfd70061daecf411c924fdc11b7e41

subject: Allow in-place updates for all compatible types
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-16 19:26:07.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/update.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_create_update.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Allow in-place updates for all compatible types

We previously only allowed a resource to update in-place when the 'type'
field in the old and new templates matched. In an age of environment type
mappings, this is incorrect. Instead, allow a resource to be updated
in-place when the old and new resource plugins are of the same class, since
this is actually what determines whether handle_update is capable of
correctly updating the resource in-place.

There is a special-case for TemplateResource as we currently subclass it
for each template type, but all TemplateResource subclasses are in fact
capable of converting between each other via a stack update.

Change-Id: Iba4abf5efd9737ca6a17d8c91d5c54ab6d3f12e0
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1508115
"}]
commit_message:
Allow in-place updates for all compatible types

We previously only allowed a resource to update in-place when the 'type'
field in the old and new templates matched. In an age of environment type
mappings, this is incorrect. Instead, allow a resource to be updated
in-place when the old and new resource plugins are of the same class, since
this is actually what determines whether handle_update is capable of
correctly updating the resource in-place.

There is a special-case for TemplateResource as we currently subclass it
for each template type, but all TemplateResource subclasses are in fact
capable of converting between each other via a stack update.

Change-Id: Iba4abf5efd9737ca6a17d8c91d5c54ab6d3f12e0
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1508115

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-11-11 09:23:33.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/service-status-notification.rst'], 'message': 'Add notification for service status change

Today external system cannot get notification based information about the nova
service status. Nova service status can be changed administratively via
via os-services/disable API.

Having such a notification helps to measure the length of maintenance windows
or indirectly notify users about maintenance actions that possibly effect the
operation of the infrastructure.

bp service-status-notification

Change-Id: Ib040cbb2917a99bc3164aa7efd09059f3318df1f
'}]
commit_message:
Add notification for service status change

Today external system cannot get notification based information about the nova
service status. Nova service status can be changed administratively via
via os-services/disable API.

Having such a notification helps to measure the length of maintenance windows
or indirectly notify users about maintenance actions that possibly effect the
operation of the infrastructure.

bp service-status-notification

Change-Id: Ib040cbb2917a99bc3164aa7efd09059f3318df1f

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-11-05 08:52:52.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/versioned-notification-api.rst'], 'message': 'Versioned notification API

The notification interface of nova is not well defined and the current
notifications define a very inconsistent interface. There is no easy
way to see from the notification consumer point of view what is the format
and the content of the notification nova sends.

Implements: blueprint versioned-notification-api
Change-Id: Ieda738ffabdb8f826865052dd01a3ecb8dfe20dd
'}]
commit_message:
Versioned notification API

The notification interface of nova is not well defined and the current
notifications define a very inconsistent interface. There is no easy
way to see from the notification consumer point of view what is the format
and the content of the notification nova sends.

Implements: blueprint versioned-notification-api
Change-Id: Ieda738ffabdb8f826865052dd01a3ecb8dfe20dd

subject: Make identity_client use **kwargs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-09 12:30:39.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/identity/v3/json/identity_client.py'], 'message': 'Make identity_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes identity_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I65cd07d4263d42e858f17a307e74cf9735cdf7f9
'}]
commit_message:
Make identity_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes identity_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I65cd07d4263d42e858f17a307e74cf9735cdf7f9

subject: Fix race condition for /openstack directories
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-12 08:52:59.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/openstack_hosts/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/openstack_hosts/tasks/openstack_dirs.yml'], 'message': 'Fix race condition for /openstack directories

To resolve a possible race condition when containers are creating
log directories the /openstack directory and its basic sub-directories
are being created within the openstack_hosts role which will ensure that
the appropriate skeleton is available when the containers go to build
in subsequent tasks.

Closes-bug: #1426254
Change-Id: Icdbddf285f8b898518657b082a9263a2923c97c4
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit de6f3a21e04daff5ea583653bef6ed62de624635)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition for /openstack directories

To resolve a possible race condition when containers are creating
log directories the /openstack directory and its basic sub-directories
are being created within the openstack_hosts role which will ensure that
the appropriate skeleton is available when the containers go to build
in subsequent tasks.

Closes-bug: #1426254
Change-Id: Icdbddf285f8b898518657b082a9263a2923c97c4
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit de6f3a21e04daff5ea583653bef6ed62de624635)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-10 09:50:27.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings'], 'message': "devstack: Use midonet stable/v2015.06.2 by default

v1 support has been removed from midonet master.
stable/v2015.06.2 is the last stable branch with v1 support.

This change goes to stable/kilo directly because it isn't
appropriate for master.  For master, we are going to make
v2 (aka ZOOM) the default. [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/220705/

Closes-Bug: #1482080
Change-Id: I472aa3392f3265e2d047cbc5391f380ea649c0f0
"}]
commit_message:
devstack: Use midonet stable/v2015.06.2 by default

v1 support has been removed from midonet master.
stable/v2015.06.2 is the last stable branch with v1 support.

This change goes to stable/kilo directly because it isn't
appropriate for master.  For master, we are going to make
v2 (aka ZOOM) the default. [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/220705/

Closes-Bug: #1482080
Change-Id: I472aa3392f3265e2d047cbc5391f380ea649c0f0

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-11 19:02:31.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': "Only take the first global, non temporary ipv6 address

Taking a temporary IPv6 address created through the OS' support for
Privacy Extensions (RFC 4941) is not very useful. It would occur because
it happened to be the first in the list returned from ip(8). Instead,
grab the first IPv6 address that is not a temporary address.

Related-Bug: #1488691

Change-Id: I7f455572241e7d0c7406f173239a2270a4d8926a
"}]
commit_message:
Only take the first global, non temporary ipv6 address

Taking a temporary IPv6 address created through the OS' support for
Privacy Extensions (RFC 4941) is not very useful. It would occur because
it happened to be the first in the list returned from ip(8). Instead,
grab the first IPv6 address that is not a temporary address.

Related-Bug: #1488691

Change-Id: I7f455572241e7d0c7406f173239a2270a4d8926a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-16 10:35:14.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/admin/test_live_migration.py'], 'message': "Fix AttributeError in multinode jobs

I62006b7e636b1773f4f41709cfec1fd6daae3c4f introduced a bug where
the `skip_checks` method tries to access a compute client but the
compute client is not yet setup because the `setup_clients` has
not been called yet (`skip_checks` is always called before  `setup_clients`)
Hence the AttributeError.

The fix gets the number of compute nodes available through a newly introduced
config flag [1]. This way we don't dynamically discover the number of compute
nodes and we don't have to call any client.

[1]: I7d7230d100901179a1d1a0281aa8be990d00c02a

Closes-Bug: #1516561
Change-Id: I1b9474d2f0f0c2edea5ade4381c4c079804f10d5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in multinode jobs

I62006b7e636b1773f4f41709cfec1fd6daae3c4f introduced a bug where
the `skip_checks` method tries to access a compute client but the
compute client is not yet setup because the `setup_clients` has
not been called yet (`skip_checks` is always called before  `setup_clients`)
Hence the AttributeError.

The fix gets the number of compute nodes available through a newly introduced
config flag [1]. This way we don't dynamically discover the number of compute
nodes and we don't have to call any client.

[1]: I7d7230d100901179a1d1a0281aa8be990d00c02a

Closes-Bug: #1516561
Change-Id: I1b9474d2f0f0c2edea5ade4381c4c079804f10d5

commit_message:
Rename references to compute floating IPs client

The single network client is being split out into multiple
clients, one of which will be called FloatingIpsClient. This patch
renames references to the compute floating ips client (floating_ips_client
changed to compute_floating_ips_client) to avoid confusion or conflicts
with the new neutron floating IPs client in code that will reference both
the nova and neutron floating IPs clients.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ie6dbd6d490a12bd8c62abbf73e1e848cc35f7d64

commit_message:
Resolve nested get_file in nested yaml/template.

For now, heatclient only resolve nested template if this
template contains heat template header. This patch extend
this function to all yaml/json files.

Change-Id: I619cecf16fc8ca3b1dbef54283b42b9b81f3b103

commit_message:
Support initialization state in Backup Manager

This commit adds is_working method to Backup Manager class to
return initialization state of the underlying volume drivers and
indicate that service has some problems and isn't running correctly.
This is used to block refreshing Service heartbeats if Manager will
return False from is_working.

Related-Bug: 1446750
Change-Id: I3165d01f60bd80ead5163d8678886bd2828af3f9

commit_message:
Rename get_server_group to show_server_group

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to server_group client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I75307176c2f032301da6227249070c42af54dd6e

subject: tox: add /bin/bash to whitelist_externals
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-09 09:40:14.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'tox: add /bin/bash to whitelist_externals

Since tox 1.5, commands outside the virtual environment must be
explicitly listed in whitelist_externals. Without that, some commands
emit the warning:

    WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
       cmd: /bin/bash
       env: ...
    See also the whitelist_externals envconfig setting.

Change-Id: Iad1f623defbb32dafb5bad3613cec7a8409e2b2c
'}]
commit_message:
tox: add /bin/bash to whitelist_externals

Since tox 1.5, commands outside the virtual environment must be
explicitly listed in whitelist_externals. Without that, some commands
emit the warning:

    WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
       cmd: /bin/bash
       env: ...
    See also the whitelist_externals envconfig setting.

Change-Id: Iad1f623defbb32dafb5bad3613cec7a8409e2b2c

commit_message:
Update building for liberty

Disable all non-translated and non-versioned guides for translation.
Only build backported guides (install-guide and config-reference).
Do not publish web pages.

commit_message:
[V3] Make region_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes region_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Icde61f9b50bbf3269ede0074d70396355e83b755

commit_message:
[V3] Make credentials_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes credentials_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Icf953bf7234376a877831f88313d935aec25f9bb

commit_message:
Remove the useless l3plugin check in l3_rpc.py

Without "L3_ROUTER_NAT" in neutron's service_plugins, l3_rpc will
fail when getting l3plugin. So, remove the useless "if" block
here.

Change-Id: I56f417e5723ed40c70a186394de0bfcff696e469
Closes-Bug: #1514144

commit_message:
Reactivating admin public image returns 500

The actual call is reactivate not activate. Therefore to stop the
internal server error occuring the activate needs to be renamed.

Change-Id: I9c74a3cd2bd460c6947477052af07838ef278d59
Closes-bug: 1515305

commit_message:
Python3: fix glance.tests.unit.test_migrations

In Python3, map() is only called if it is consumed. The calls removed
in this patch were no-ops.

Change-Id: I83e2ee05bcda4b765d67dfb6558c6e59afe6f816

subject: Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-16 00:47:09.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically

Change-Id: I741b7cae51555bc5f8d79a018598d1dccbba4459"}]
commit_message:
Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically

Change-Id: I741b7cae51555bc5f8d79a018598d1dccbba4459

subject: Block keystonemiddleware 2.4.0 and keystoneclient 1.8.0
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 8978, 'name': 'Marek Denis', 'email': 'marek.denis+openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'marek-denis'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-16 13:47:39.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Block keystonemiddleware 2.4.0 and keystoneclient 1.8.0

The keystonemiddleware 2.4.0 release and keystoneclient 1.8.0 release
contain invalid requirements, capping WebOb that was supposed to be
temporary. This caused keystone-all to fail to start due to
conflicting requirements with other packages.

Change-Id: I7e1e3885d7ea64640a1fa12c51bab1d51ab0dcb3
Related-Bug: 1505996
(cherry picked from commit 3d36502b15abf8146e985dc21a185f0c159d2430)
'}]
commit_message:
Block keystonemiddleware 2.4.0 and keystoneclient 1.8.0

The keystonemiddleware 2.4.0 release and keystoneclient 1.8.0 release
contain invalid requirements, capping WebOb that was supposed to be
temporary. This caused keystone-all to fail to start due to
conflicting requirements with other packages.

Change-Id: I7e1e3885d7ea64640a1fa12c51bab1d51ab0dcb3
Related-Bug: 1505996
(cherry picked from commit 3d36502b15abf8146e985dc21a185f0c159d2430)

commit_message:
Feature/Bug workflow corrections

Removing broken reference in index.rst that raised a warning.

Changing the Security bug process to file security bug first rather
than having to track down Searchlight security or VMT first.

Change-Id: Iea69c94ce2ed05688e0b93e6f00c4991f4cf1341

subject: Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-16 00:23:21.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically


Change-Id: I3564e6d2dfaf64b573382d776e6a79a442750139"}]
commit_message:
Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically


Change-Id: I3564e6d2dfaf64b573382d776e6a79a442750139

commit_message:
Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically


Change-Id: I5defad3ba70eac774a01b2137abbffcd812cd0d5

subject: Enable "openstack server unlock" command to take multiple servers.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-12 03:26:52.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/commands.rst', 'doc/source/command-objects/server.rst', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': 'Enable "openstack server unlock" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server unlock" command could only unlock one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve the
doc to reflect the new feature.

Change-Id: Ibf57b2021a504da950a491d63139a438087aed0b
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers
'}]
commit_message:
Enable "openstack server unlock" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server unlock" command could only unlock one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve the
doc to reflect the new feature.

Change-Id: Ibf57b2021a504da950a491d63139a438087aed0b
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers

commit_message:
Filter out disk.config for existing instances without config drive

Even force_config_drive is changed to True or always, existing
instances which are not configured with config drive should still
keep the old behavior.

Change-Id: I074a5823645a3e18cc8cd6824c1058adff36a34d
Closes-Bug: #1356534
Co-authored-by: wuhao <wuhao@unitedstack.com>

revisions:

Since we only have a single module right now, we don't need to full
ability to zuul-clone.  We are also running into a 127 char shebang
limit with execve so this will reduce our directory name.

Change-Id: I024f414ddae85621a861b21d284ea1e417c4438d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Switch ansible-functional job zuul-git-prep

Since we only have a single module right now, we don't need to full
ability to zuul-clone.  We are also running into a 127 char shebang
limit with execve so this will reduce our directory name.

Change-Id: I024f414ddae85621a861b21d284ea1e417c4438d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: remove unnecessary else in blockinfo.get_root_info

The "if no_root_bdm" conditional returns on it's own so there is no
reason to have the else check.

This is just trivial code cleanup.

Change-Id: I82e310b769d6a218cd94c785830f453795075b53

subject: Increase minimal Jinja2 version from 2.6 to 2.8
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-09 14:44:06.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Increase minimal Jinja2 version from 2.6 to 2.8

Jinja version 2.6 does not support Python v3.

Jinja version 2.8 is latest stable release
ant it supports Python v3 (actually from version 2.7)

http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/dev/intro/#experimental-python-3-support

Change-Id: I4c2e3746429def850053dcc7d204dd488c033cbc
'}]
commit_message:
Increase minimal Jinja2 version from 2.6 to 2.8

Jinja version 2.6 does not support Python v3.

Jinja version 2.8 is latest stable release
ant it supports Python v3 (actually from version 2.7)

http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/dev/intro/#experimental-python-3-support

Change-Id: I4c2e3746429def850053dcc7d204dd488c033cbc

subject: Bump oslo.service to latest version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-11 13:50:30.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump oslo.service to latest version

The latest oslo.service release exposes a new configuration
option, as such we should bump to this version, otherwise
folks configuring this option with an old version of
oslo.service may get incorrect results.

Change-Id: I3dd0692743fcecff056674580fe57901963b4ccd
'}]
commit_message:
Bump oslo.service to latest version

The latest oslo.service release exposes a new configuration
option, as such we should bump to this version, otherwise
folks configuring this option with an old version of
oslo.service may get incorrect results.

Change-Id: I3dd0692743fcecff056674580fe57901963b4ccd

commit_message:
Bumps os-win version to 0.0.6

Adds utilsfactory function get_smbutils.
Adds iscsi_target_utils methods (iscsi_target_exists, extend_wt_disk).
Adds IO related utils for serial console handlers.
Adds share capacity info bugfix.
Adds Secure Boot related utils.

Change-Id: Id5cd1dce195b38611f4f8c74857087620048b13f

network. In this case tenant user can assign floating ips to its
VMs though it does not own the router.
For proper notification we need to get router info using admin
context.

Closes-Bug: #1507602
Change-Id: I17330ddca577d15e42c13ef0af96d56e6f20abd7
"}]
commit_message:
Use admin context when requesting floating ip's router info

Currently it is possible for admin to create router and add any
tenant subnet to it, thus connecting the subnet to the external
network. In this case tenant user can assign floating ips to its
VMs though it does not own the router.
For proper notification we need to get router info using admin
context.

Closes-Bug: #1507602
Change-Id: I17330ddca577d15e42c13ef0af96d56e6f20abd7

commit_message:
Improve validation of input node labels data via jsonschema

Now node labels are validated according to following rules:
* node labels data is dictionary where keys are names of labels and
  values are also values of labels;
* Label name must be string less than 100 symbols also non-empty;
* Label value must be either None (null in json format) or string also
  less that 100 symbols and non-empty

Change-Id: Iac3e9a33591a52ba48510be26316d665322961a2
Closes-Bug: #1482639

subject: Allow a user to override the toxworkdir (tox.ini)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-17 01:06:36.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/run-tox.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/run-cover.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/run-pep8.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/run-docs.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/run-selenium.sh'], 'message': 'Allow a user to override the toxworkdir (tox.ini)

We are starting to run into tox issue with job names longer then 127
chars [1].  Because our jenkins nodes are destroyed after each run, we
can allow a job to override the toxworkdir setting in tox.ini (for example
/tmp).

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/79/245979/1/check/gate-ansible-dsvm-functional-centos7-nv/f24bec8/console.html#_2015-11-16_23_27_03_935

Change-Id: I6858a2ffec0585d6e747086103e66e891b20f84d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Allow a user to override the toxworkdir (tox.ini)

We are starting to run into tox issue with job names longer then 127
chars [1].  Because our jenkins nodes are destroyed after each run, we
can allow a job to override the toxworkdir setting in tox.ini (for example
/tmp).

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/79/245979/1/check/gate-ansible-dsvm-functional-centos7-nv/f24bec8/console.html#_2015-11-16_23_27_03_935

Change-Id: I6858a2ffec0585d6e747086103e66e891b20f84d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: cleanup tox.ini
revisions:

* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* sitepackages : default is already false


Change-Id: Id13307a8f7c21496e1d5aad20cd9e2146b8f2fbd"}]
commit_message:
cleanup tox.ini

* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* sitepackages : default is already false


Change-Id: Id13307a8f7c21496e1d5aad20cd9e2146b8f2fbd

commit_message:
Adds Cinder Volume Support to Swarm Bay Type

Previously, the swarm bay type did not support using a cinder
volume for docker.

Implements: blueprint swarm-cinder

Change-Id: I8acaf60caab52a5e5a234e4c5f89ce3dd155759c

commit_message:
fix html context event handler

The event handler should return a replacement template *name* or None.
Since we don't want to change the template, return None.

Change-Id: I3012ad22505230c488aa4babbd4141d903b7ab0d
Closes-Bug: 1516834

commit_message:
Add total_vms field in API

* bump the api version to 2.13
* add the total_vms to api
* change the current running_vms to the count of the active instances

Closes-Bug: #1325304
Change-Id: I385804e4c220e6c35ee47105106ea6c60e5df9ce

commit_message:
libvirt: Rollback status when cold migrate failed

When you can't access target host during cold migrating,
VM status doesn't rollback.

Cold migration uses ssh command.
There's a precondition which a target host can be connected
using ssh Host key from a source host without prompt.

So, when you are using util.execute(), especially ssh can use
following options.
options : -T
          -o BatchMode=yes
          -e none

And if you want to change ssh port as 2022 for security reason,
you can change ssh options using nova.conf

[libvirt]
ssh_connection_options=-T, -o BatchMode=yes, -e none, -p 2022

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1323989

Change-Id: I4e4155cce5f4d4bcbd02dd2d865017cda79626ab

commit_message:
Correct disk filter in dealing with volume-based instance

Disk filter should not count root disk size when the instance is
booted from volume.

This patch checks the block device mapping to judge whether the
instance is booted from volume. And if the instance if booted from
volume, the root device size will not be counted.

Change-Id: I511a95a4025788216adfea8e9837289acba97329
Closes-Bug: #1358566

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-21 19:11:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/consoleauth/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/consoleauth/test_consoleauth.py'], 'message': "Add support for one time tokens in consoleauth

Currently knowing the value of the 'token' is all the authentication that is
required for consoleauth connections.  Should this token be discovered by an
unauthorised user it's possible for that person to gain access to the console
of a VM.  The outcome of this depends on what state the console is in.

This patch reduces potential impact of this token being discovered.

When the new config option (console_one_time_token) is enabled all
consoleauth tokens are single use.

This config option should be used in conjunction with console_token_ttl to
minimise the possibility that a token will be mis used.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1447679
Change-Id: I2f71611d26bd2547edc354ab8235303115157e30
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for one time tokens in consoleauth

Currently knowing the value of the 'token' is all the authentication that is
required for consoleauth connections.  Should this token be discovered by an
unauthorised user it's possible for that person to gain access to the console
of a VM.  The outcome of this depends on what state the console is in.

This patch reduces potential impact of this token being discovered.

When the new config option (console_one_time_token) is enabled all
consoleauth tokens are single use.

This config option should be used in conjunction with console_token_ttl to
minimise the possibility that a token will be mis used.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1447679
Change-Id: I2f71611d26bd2547edc354ab8235303115157e30

listener can take some action based on job completion.

commit_message:
Serialize user auth plugin

This is an important part of allowing the plugin to be used in
conjunction with context and policy. We need the ability to pass the
token coming from the user over RPC within a service.

Allow serializing the user plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1459481
Change-Id: I3881cc59f66e01797cdbdc9c40ae454929675a4e

{{ hostname }} is not defined anywhere, and trying to use it results in

The variable inventory_hostname is defined and is a reasonable name for

commit_message:
Fix variable name for dhcp-hosts file name

{{ hostname }} is not defined anywhere, and trying to use it results in
the following error:

  fatal: [node.example.com -> localhost] => One or more undefined variables: 'hostname' is undefined

The variable inventory_hostname is defined and is a reasonable name for
this file, so use that instead.

Change-Id: I6aebf7fd25c9fc279b42fab9414ede81c5afacf6

P.S. I would like to add it in routers, we'd better to LOG which controller
is called, but since we are inherited from pecan, we don't want so much
hacking to base class.

Closes-Bug: #1516464
Change-Id: I24543dfcb97a90b2849813ce7aaeb8904f7d50ca
'}]
commit_message:
API: Add debug message for every API call

Added debug messages for each API call. It will helpful for debugging,
especially on gate.

This log message will be only print out when the request has body, and output
will be like follows:

Processing request: url: http://10.238.157.49:9511/v1/bays, POST, body:
{"name": "k8s", "discovery_url": null, "master_count": 1, "baymodel_id":
"e5534156-7b7d-4ddf-afe9-f4189a5e77fe", "node_count": "1",
"bay_create_timeout": null}

P.S. I would like to add it in routers, we'd better to LOG which controller
is called, but since we are inherited from pecan, we don't want so much
hacking to base class.

Closes-Bug: #1516464
Change-Id: I24543dfcb97a90b2849813ce7aaeb8904f7d50ca

commit_message:
Add "unreleased" release notes page

We need a release notes page to show notes for unreleased versions by
scanning the "current" branch. This ensures that notes files cannot be
merged if they break the releasenotes job.

Change-Id: Ifeb96a9c475c2f2b8fd1cac031c316b0846aa9eb
(cherry picked from commit 5373ba49b051e08d33f5d48a47434bd61cc5526e)

subject: Adding 'messaging' as prefix for Zaqar commands
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-01 20:59:42.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': "Adding 'messaging' as prefix for Zaqar commands

Due to the limitation of openstackclient, different services may
run into name conflict for similar functions. For example, Zaqar's
flavor and Nova's flavor. So we'd like to use 'messaging' as the
prefix for all Zaqar's commands.

Besides, to keep the back compatibility, the old commands will
still be kept for v1.

Change-Id: I718f06e9c611df02f7a7b479b3a50956de95ea61
"}]
commit_message:
Adding 'messaging' as prefix for Zaqar commands

Due to the limitation of openstackclient, different services may
run into name conflict for similar functions. For example, Zaqar's
flavor and Nova's flavor. So we'd like to use 'messaging' as the
prefix for all Zaqar's commands.

Besides, to keep the back compatibility, the old commands will
still be kept for v1.

Change-Id: I718f06e9c611df02f7a7b479b3a50956de95ea61

commit_message:
Add reno for release notes management

As per the release process changes for liberty and mitaka [1], the
reno tooling is being added to the repository for the purpose of
implementing on-going release note additions.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/078301.html

This patch is primarily for testing release note builds and has
therefore been modified from the original commit.

subject: Use XML matcher
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-09 21:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/tests/unit/extras/saml2/test_auth_adfs.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/extras/saml2/test_auth_saml2.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/extras/saml2/utils.py'], 'message': "Use XML matcher

The XML comparisons were done using strings that were slightly
normalized by removing newlines. This isn't a safe way to do XML
comparison since XML documents that are represented differently as
strings can still be the same. For example, the shortened
namespace can be different or attributes can be in different order.

XML comparisons should be done using the XML matcher so that
differences in the exact representation are allowed.

Change-Id: Id26531eb0f55b45a257ea22eb7263524158f45f9
"}]
commit_message:
Use XML matcher

The XML comparisons were done using strings that were slightly
normalized by removing newlines. This isn't a safe way to do XML
comparison since XML documents that are represented differently as
strings can still be the same. For example, the shortened
namespace can be different or attributes can be in different order.

XML comparisons should be done using the XML matcher so that
differences in the exact representation are allowed.

Change-Id: Id26531eb0f55b45a257ea22eb7263524158f45f9

subject: Add a executor backed conductor and have existing impl. use it
revisions:
[{'number': 26, 'created': '2015-11-13 01:03:15.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/tests/unit/conductor/__init__.py', 'taskflow/conductors/backends/impl_executor.py', 'taskflow/conductors/backends/impl_nonblocking.py', 'taskflow/conductors/backends/impl_blocking.py', 'taskflow/conductors/base.py', 'taskflow/jobs/base.py', 'doc/source/conductors.rst', 'taskflow/types/timing.py', 'taskflow/utils/threading_utils.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_conductors.py', 'setup.cfg', 'taskflow/utils/misc.py'], 'message': "Add a executor backed conductor and have existing impl. use it

This adds a executor backed job dispatching base class
and has the existing blocking executor use it by running jobs
and dispatching jobs into a sync executor. It also allows
for dispatching jobs into a thread executor, or other executor
via a new '_executor_factory' method that can generate
executors (it can be overriden in the non-blocking executor
to provide your own executors instances).

This does alter the behavior in that now that jobs are dispatched
into an executor we no longer can immediatly know if a job was
dispatched and raised an exception or whether it will raise an
exception in the future, so we now alter the 'local_dispatched'
to just be a boolean that is used to determine if any dispatches
happened (failure or not).

Change-Id: I485770e8f4c85d3833892a453c9fb5168d8f0407
"}]
commit_message:
Add a executor backed conductor and have existing impl. use it

This adds a executor backed job dispatching base class
and has the existing blocking executor use it by running jobs
and dispatching jobs into a sync executor. It also allows
for dispatching jobs into a thread executor, or other executor
via a new '_executor_factory' method that can generate
executors (it can be overriden in the non-blocking executor
to provide your own executors instances).

This does alter the behavior in that now that jobs are dispatched
into an executor we no longer can immediatly know if a job was
dispatched and raised an exception or whether it will raise an
exception in the future, so we now alter the 'local_dispatched'
to just be a boolean that is used to determine if any dispatches
happened (failure or not).

Change-Id: I485770e8f4c85d3833892a453c9fb5168d8f0407

subject: Update documentation for automatic index creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-14 01:07:49.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/elasticsearch.rst'], 'message': 'Update documentation for automatic index creation

The current documentation mentions setting action.create_index to
disable automatic index creation, but the setting should be
action.auto_create_index.  The action.auto_create_index setting is
specified in elasticsearch docs such as this one:

http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs-index_.html

Change-Id: I27e87d64a683a4ea1b4dbc0577ef44194dbb6873
'}]
commit_message:
Update documentation for automatic index creation

The current documentation mentions setting action.create_index to
disable automatic index creation, but the setting should be
action.auto_create_index.  The action.auto_create_index setting is
specified in elasticsearch docs such as this one:

http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs-index_.html

Change-Id: I27e87d64a683a4ea1b4dbc0577ef44194dbb6873

revisions:

When there is a live migration failure that prevents the VM
from moving to the destination host, any hdisks created on the
destination host should be deleted. These hdisks are created

to the VM via VSCSI.

Change-Id: I6e7f88ede68522c9f4788c549b8bfc84f7ae382a
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up hdisks after failed live migration

When there is a live migration failure that prevents the VM
from moving to the destination host, any hdisks created on the
destination host should be deleted. These hdisks are created
when we do the discovery operation for any volumes attached
to the VM via VSCSI.

Change-Id: I6e7f88ede68522c9f4788c549b8bfc84f7ae382a

commit_message:
Allow users to filter projects

On the dashboard page, users will be allowed to filter projects they are
interested on seeing on the project listing.

commit_message:
Extract test run aggregation into separated class

hard to follow. This commit extracts this logic into its own class as
well includes unit tests around it.

subject: Remove 'raise' in _get
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-16 14:06:16.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Remove 'raise' in _get

The affected code raises a KeyError to reach the except block, instead
of using normal code structure. Although try/except blocks are cheap,
actually throwing an exception takes quite a few cycles. Checking
config options is supposed to be very cheap so we should avoid
unnecessary performance hits like this.

Change-Id: I0de7919a651b42007526371ad8f3fe97a446afb6
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'raise' in _get

The affected code raises a KeyError to reach the except block, instead
of using normal code structure. Although try/except blocks are cheap,
actually throwing an exception takes quite a few cycles. Checking
config options is supposed to be very cheap so we should avoid
unnecessary performance hits like this.

Change-Id: I0de7919a651b42007526371ad8f3fe97a446afb6

commit_message:
Modify test case for broader coverage

This particular test as changed in this patch fails tox on local machines
where URL gets redirected by internet service provider. This was observed on
multiple machines running Linux VM on Mac and Windows. Also adding i18n for
message and parameterizing it.

subject: Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-16 00:42:19.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically

Change-Id: Iad4623157750ca3808f5b2adb712814c98d824fa"}]
commit_message:
Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically

Change-Id: Iad4623157750ca3808f5b2adb712814c98d824fa

revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2015-11-14 15:15:03.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/themes/default/horizon/_styles.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/default/bootstrap/components/_tables.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/default/horizon/components/_tables.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/components/_table_actions.scss', 'horizon/tables/actions.py', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/default/horizon/components/_table_actions.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/img/up_arrow.png', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/components/_tables.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/horizon.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/default/bootstrap/_variables.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/default/bootstrap/_styles.scss', 'doc/source/topics/customizing.rst', 'horizon/templates/horizon/common/_data_table.html', 'horizon/templates/horizon/common/_data_table_table_actions.html'], 'message': 'Basic tables now inherit from Bootstrap Theme

Horizon tables had many hardcoded padding and colors in them, which
made them not theme-ready.  This patch vets all the old table styles
for their current usage (if any) and reimplemented the necessary
rules to inherit from the theme.

There were a number of styles that were obviously not being used any
longer. These rules were removed.  There were also many rules that
were very difficult to determine their lineage, as the scss lacks
much needed commentary on why some styles exist (if they are working
around specific browser issues, or usability glitches, etc).

A few examples of some of these removed styles include:
 * th.narrow
 * td.select
 * th span.required:after

This patch does not include refactor of the dropdowns or inline edit.

Immediate Improvements:
 * Table Actions are now all consistent heights
 * The cursor is a pointer ONLY on sortable rows now
 * The column sort indicator is now an icon font, therefore high def
 * table_header height no longer hardcoded, can grow with theme
 * Slow waiting cursor style using global selector * removed
 * Many dead styles were removed!!
 * Hovering on status_unknown rows now keeps proper color

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards
Change-Id: I4a904704926dc50010ad480539db828eff559fa0
'}]
commit_message:
Basic tables now inherit from Bootstrap Theme

Horizon tables had many hardcoded padding and colors in them, which
made them not theme-ready.  This patch vets all the old table styles
for their current usage (if any) and reimplemented the necessary
rules to inherit from the theme.

There were a number of styles that were obviously not being used any
longer. These rules were removed.  There were also many rules that
were very difficult to determine their lineage, as the scss lacks
much needed commentary on why some styles exist (if they are working
around specific browser issues, or usability glitches, etc).

A few examples of some of these removed styles include:
 * th.narrow
 * td.select
 * th span.required:after

This patch does not include refactor of the dropdowns or inline edit.

Immediate Improvements:
 * Table Actions are now all consistent heights
 * The cursor is a pointer ONLY on sortable rows now
 * The column sort indicator is now an icon font, therefore high def
 * table_header height no longer hardcoded, can grow with theme
 * Slow waiting cursor style using global selector * removed
 * Many dead styles were removed!!
 * Hovering on status_unknown rows now keeps proper color

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards
Change-Id: I4a904704926dc50010ad480539db828eff559fa0

commit_message:
Add "unreleased" release notes page

We need a release notes page to show notes for unreleased versions by
scanning the "current" branch. This ensures that notes files cannot be
merged if they break the releasenotes job.

Change-Id: Ifeb96a9c475c2f2b8fd1cac031c316b0846aa9eb

commit_message:
install database when collector is enabled.

Currently, if we run devstack for compute node, ceilometer-collector
service will be disabled on compute node, but the database is still
installed.

This patch makes sure that database is installed only when collector
is enabled.

Also add check for coordinate and hypervisor requirements.

Change-Id: Ib3614d2e698403c24ad299d95ef42c81815fa76e
Closes-Bug: #1508518

commit_message:
xenapi_device_id integer, expected string

XAPI expects to get a string, not an integer, so we convert it to a
string before assigning it to the rec dictionary.

The current test examples use a device_id of "0002". To keep consistency,
minimize changes, and prevent introducing further bugs, the string is
zero padded to maintain this format.

Change-Id: I1a6b11ced0dc053903e91378203f5afb5740fa79
Closes-bug: #1503423

Fix to preserve double dashes of command line option in HTML.

double dashes of command line option by enclosing the option in double
back quote such as ``--standalone`` and ``--debug``.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-15 21:46:44.000000000', 'files': ['USECASES.md'], 'message': "Update the 'I want to try this' use case manifest

The 'I want to try this' manifest provided in USECASES.md no longer
cleanly applies.  This patch updates the manifest so that it passes
syntax checks and applies cleanly on a new Ubuntu 14.04 virtual machine
with a second disk located at /dev/vdb.

Additional changes are required to make this manifest apply cleanly to
RHEL or CentOS machines.  Those changes are outlined in bug #1411424,
and I believe they are separate issues that should be addressed outside
of this sample use case.

Change-Id: I3f93381ca05d5b73fae35121c475356c59a5ab2a
Closes-Bug: 1411424
"}]
commit_message:
Update the 'I want to try this' use case manifest

The 'I want to try this' manifest provided in USECASES.md no longer
cleanly applies.  This patch updates the manifest so that it passes
syntax checks and applies cleanly on a new Ubuntu 14.04 virtual machine
with a second disk located at /dev/vdb.

Additional changes are required to make this manifest apply cleanly to
RHEL or CentOS machines.  Those changes are outlined in bug #1411424,
and I believe they are separate issues that should be addressed outside
of this sample use case.

Change-Id: I3f93381ca05d5b73fae35121c475356c59a5ab2a
Closes-Bug: 1411424

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 7065, 'name': 'Brad P. Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11491, 'name': 'Gael Chamoulaud', 'email': 'gchamoul@redhat.com', 'username': 'gchamoul'}, {'_account_id': 11997, 'name': 'Lennart Regebro', 'email': 'lregebro@redhat.com', 'username': 'lregebro'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-16 03:27:16.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'requirements.txt', 'tripleoclient/utils.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Log all resource events during overcloud deploy

This change switches the overcloud deploy stack polling with event
list polling. This uses the same technique as the recently added
heat stack-create --poll mode: Ib7d35b66521f0ccca8544fd18fb70e04eaf98e5a

There is a (CREATE|UPDATE)_(COMPLETE|FAILED) event generated when the stack
operation is complete, so this is used to decide when to stop polling.

Also, every time there is an event it is printed to the screen in log
style. This would give the user an indication that something is
happening, which is better than staring at nothing for minutes (hours).

On stack update, the oldest event from the previous operation is discovered and
that is used for the marker so that only new events are logged.

Change-Id: I8951b0b924db769961aa67e654fcbd774d3e7787
'}]
commit_message:
Log all resource events during overcloud deploy

This change switches the overcloud deploy stack polling with event
list polling. This uses the same technique as the recently added
heat stack-create --poll mode: Ib7d35b66521f0ccca8544fd18fb70e04eaf98e5a

There is a (CREATE|UPDATE)_(COMPLETE|FAILED) event generated when the stack
operation is complete, so this is used to decide when to stop polling.

Also, every time there is an event it is printed to the screen in log
style. This would give the user an indication that something is
happening, which is better than staring at nothing for minutes (hours).

On stack update, the oldest event from the previous operation is discovered and
that is used for the marker so that only new events are logged.

Change-Id: I8951b0b924db769961aa67e654fcbd774d3e7787

commit_message:
Adds puppet-manila to install from source list

For DIB_INSTALLTYPE_puppet_modules=source, the change that added
manila https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186406/ didn't add it to
the environment.d script which exports the individual module env
vars like DIB_INSTALLTYPE_puppet-manila

I think this may explain the errors we get in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/188137

Change-Id: If0b08df9f09f62a04e6cff11c451599312d9a09b

This reverts to using Chrome with direct connect for E2E tests,
as build nodes should already have a configured virtual X server
for npm jobs. This also removes the need for Selenium, which
should speed up environment setup.

PhantomJS appears to be somewhat unreliable for E2E testing, and
does not allow for some extra features, such as reading from
browser console logs.

Change-Id: I77a4fa86469c96af5494dc8118217d47abbc6dea
'}]
commit_message:
Use Chrome for Protractor E2E testing.

This reverts to using Chrome with direct connect for E2E tests,
as build nodes should already have a configured virtual X server
for npm jobs. This also removes the need for Selenium, which
should speed up environment setup.

PhantomJS appears to be somewhat unreliable for E2E testing, and
does not allow for some extra features, such as reading from
browser console logs.

Change-Id: I77a4fa86469c96af5494dc8118217d47abbc6dea

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-16 05:03:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/volumeops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_volumeops.py'], 'message': "VMware: Raise DiskNotFound for missing disk device

If volume detach fails after reconfiguring the VM to remove volume
vmdk then it will not be possible to detach the volume again. This
is because the VMware driver fails the detach operation by raising
StorageError when it finds that the volume disk device is missing.
Due to this, the volume state will remain 'in-use'.

The compute manager expects the driver to raise DiskNotFound if the
disk is missing during detach operation. It ignores the exception
and allows the detach to complete. This patch fixes the problem with
the VMware driver by throwing DiskNotFound instead of StorageError
if the volume disk device is missing.

Change-Id: I4074d240a3468534c0a269f6cd160f399e8fa18c
Closes-Bug: #1514910
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Raise DiskNotFound for missing disk device

If volume detach fails after reconfiguring the VM to remove volume
vmdk then it will not be possible to detach the volume again. This
is because the VMware driver fails the detach operation by raising
StorageError when it finds that the volume disk device is missing.
Due to this, the volume state will remain 'in-use'.

The compute manager expects the driver to raise DiskNotFound if the
disk is missing during detach operation. It ignores the exception
and allows the detach to complete. This patch fixes the problem with
the VMware driver by throwing DiskNotFound instead of StorageError
if the volume disk device is missing.

Change-Id: I4074d240a3468534c0a269f6cd160f399e8fa18c
Closes-Bug: #1514910

This patch updates 'overcloud deploy' commands so that

a unique DeployIdentifier parameter. By passing an unique
DeployIdentifier parameter into the overcloud stack we
force all puppet config tasks (which are idempotent

"}]
commit_message:
Generate a unique DeployIdentifier on updates

This patch updates 'overcloud deploy' commands so that
updates (re-running deploy on an existing stack) generate
a unique DeployIdentifier parameter. By passing an unique
DeployIdentifier parameter into the overcloud stack we
force all puppet config tasks (which are idempotent
and safe to exec multiple times) again.

We've had several issues with puppet not-rerunning on
a variety of config related changes and additionally recieved
user feedback that not re-running all puppet deployments on
an update is confusing.

Change-Id: Ia659181872a6537cc169f1d1531ebf5d36160183
Closes-bug: #1505430
Depends-On: Ic352ddd30807dc378e5e7b6c396bc53f5d6d5622

commit_message:
Delete kube-register

1. kubelet can automatically register nodes, so we don't need to
register nodes.
2. When we remove a node from the cluster, the nova instance is
terminated. So the instance has no stop process to run unregister
script. Heat has a spec [1] to add stop deletion policy now. After
this function is merged, I will add unregister script back.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243012/

Change-Id: I9b1ea0eda74f9bfba8b87c67c2bd063c62460336
Partial-Bug: #1511570

commit_message:
Refactor translate attribute and gettext() in bay panel

This patch removes unnecessary translate attribute and adds
needed gettext() in bay panel. Also removes unnecessary space.

commit_message:
Fix error in starting Docker on k8s minion

Previously, the docker service was not starting on k8s minions.
This patch updates the Docker STORAGE_OPTIONS on minions with the
correct settings.

Change-Id: I20e6c3cadbe0826dbb04ce62532af002505222a7
Closes-Bug: 1507374

commit_message:
cells is a sad panda about scheduler hints

The new test_schedule_to_all_nodes test fails in some epic ways in
cells. Not really worth debugging, this is a new test and had just
exposed another cells / devstack issue. Just skip the test.

Conflicts:
	devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc

Change-Id: Icc71e36f4ecb015dff9e806caacd31262f7e17f7
(cherry picked from commit 876679c08f05eaa2a90b1f053b65b78a0af433df)

commit_message:
Store attributes of plugins in a separate table

This is redesign of plugins architecture in order to store
the plugin's attributes in a separate table, not in cluster
attributes, so it will be possible to remove connection between
plugin and cluster when a plugin gets deleted.

Added ability to work with different versions of a plugin.
User can choose the preferred version in UI.

The test "test_plugin_generator" was removed because no longer
relevant.

Closes-Bug: #1440046
Implements: blueprint store-plugins-attributes

Change-Id: I52115f130bf1c7c80c66e18d0bf9f7acb16dd56c

This modification allows the encryption key UUID field, which
has been added to the volume table, to remain valid when encrypted
volumes are backed up and then restored, which enables the restored
volume to be accessible and encrypted.  This is related to patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39573/, except that it uses the
backup metadata support recently added in patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/51900/ rather than modifying the

Change-Id: Ib91f8275271e6bd4f2d9e17499d16ec13bca2b84
Implements: blueprint backup-support-for-encrypted-volumes
DocImpact
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for backup encryption metadata

This modification allows the encryption key UUID field, which
has been added to the volume table, to remain valid when encrypted
volumes are backed up and then restored, which enables the restored
volume to be accessible and encrypted.  This is related to patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39573/, except that it uses the
backup metadata support recently added in patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/51900/ rather than modifying the
backup api.

Change-Id: Ib91f8275271e6bd4f2d9e17499d16ec13bca2b84
Implements: blueprint backup-support-for-encrypted-volumes
DocImpact

Right now to check if some part of code supports
requested microversion developer usually:

 1. get a microversion from request.
 2. create instance of class APIVersionRequest
    with requested microversion.
 3. compare these two objects.

This check takes at least 2 lines and looks ugly.
Sometimes developers create unnecessary class fields
to store object APIVersionRequest with requested microversion.

To make nova code more readable and simple method
'is_supported' was created.

Microversion check with this method takes only one line
and code looks more beautiful.

Change-Id: I9078cfa1afad8b6b09583dac87fa757a0cc32daa
"}]
commit_message:
Added method is_supported to check API microversions

Right now to check if some part of code supports
requested microversion developer usually:

 1. get a microversion from request.
 2. create instance of class APIVersionRequest
    with requested microversion.
 3. compare these two objects.

This check takes at least 2 lines and looks ugly.
Sometimes developers create unnecessary class fields
to store object APIVersionRequest with requested microversion.

To make nova code more readable and simple method
'is_supported' was created.

Microversion check with this method takes only one line
and code looks more beautiful.

Change-Id: I9078cfa1afad8b6b09583dac87fa757a0cc32daa

commit_message:
Repair and rename test_is_volume_backed_instance_no_bdms()

The function did not assert the result of
is_volume_backed_instance(), which is fixed here.  The function uses
a mockup of get_by_instance_uuid() that returns an empty block device
map, instead of calling block_device_make_list() with an explicit
empty bdm as in another test case.  Therefore the function is renamed
to test_is_volume_backed_instance_empty_bdm_by_uuid().

Change-Id: I469f3a6ee88f1acd42bd0df7d0881e20bf68fd0c

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-09 16:23:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_scality.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/scality.py'], 'message': "ScalityVolume:fix how remote FS mount is detected

A new version of Scality Ring doesn't have a 'sys' directory at the
root level of the Scality (distributed) filesystem. But the
LibvirtScalityVolumeDriver in Nova relies on the presence of this
'sys' directory to detect whether the Scality Filesystem has been
properly mounted. This means that LibvirtScalityVolumeDriver doesn't
detect that the filesystem was already mounted.

Fix this be introducing a more robust way to detect that the remote
FS is already mounted, based on what's in /proc/mounts

While we are at it, also fix the unit tests because they had bad side
effects (they would create a TempDir with a file in it).

Change-Id: I0997f123aaed2f2c002c8084d6aab40e2f0dd5b8
Closes-Bug: #1482287
"}]
commit_message:
ScalityVolume:fix how remote FS mount is detected

A new version of Scality Ring doesn't have a 'sys' directory at the
root level of the Scality (distributed) filesystem. But the
LibvirtScalityVolumeDriver in Nova relies on the presence of this
'sys' directory to detect whether the Scality Filesystem has been
properly mounted. This means that LibvirtScalityVolumeDriver doesn't
detect that the filesystem was already mounted.

Fix this be introducing a more robust way to detect that the remote
FS is already mounted, based on what's in /proc/mounts

While we are at it, also fix the unit tests because they had bad side
effects (they would create a TempDir with a file in it).

Change-Id: I0997f123aaed2f2c002c8084d6aab40e2f0dd5b8
Closes-Bug: #1482287

commit_message:
Raise error if bad WWPNs used on connect

Raises an error if the connect volume is unable to find the appropriate
Virtual I/O Server for a WWPN.  This wraps into a proper Volume Attach
exception, so that the manager can handle the task state properly.

Change-Id: I6c98d0eb234a0e159907f68f8bd4b78255c90052
Closes-Bug: 1515357
(cherry picked from commit beacd00d1ec3e86d3b60672930d33fa17ba90634)

subject: fix grenade tempest defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-16 16:25:27.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "fix grenade tempest defaults

All grenade jobs need to run tempest, and it's forced on in
devstack-gate. However, at some point a job specified
DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=0 and it was cargo culted through this file. We
should set it to 1 to reflect reality and cause less confusion for
newcomers.

Change-Id: Ic146998587855d082321da872e9abccadcf35c15
"}]
commit_message:
fix grenade tempest defaults

All grenade jobs need to run tempest, and it's forced on in
devstack-gate. However, at some point a job specified
DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=0 and it was cargo culted through this file. We
should set it to 1 to reflect reality and cause less confusion for
newcomers.

Change-Id: Ic146998587855d082321da872e9abccadcf35c15

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-11-13 21:06:19.000000000', 'files': ['CONTRIBUTING.rst', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/feature-requests-bugs.rst'], 'message': 'Document Feature Request and Bug Workflow

Searchlight needs the feature request process and bug workflow to be
documented.

Our process is meant to allow users to express their desires for new features
using Launchpad blueprints. A quick review of blueprints can be done and
they can turn into features only requiring additional specifications should
the need arise.

This patch provides the initial process documentation. It is loosely
based on reading many mailing list threads on specs, launchpad,
and on the latest updates to the Neutron RFE / spec template process [1].

[1] http://www.siliconloons.com/posts/2015-06-01-new-neutron-rfe-process/

Change-Id: I30a7f3d4ac13d1fb621c9bdd4001a1831f7c0d16
'}]
commit_message:
Document Feature Request and Bug Workflow

Searchlight needs the feature request process and bug workflow to be
documented.

Our process is meant to allow users to express their desires for new features
using Launchpad blueprints. A quick review of blueprints can be done and
they can turn into features only requiring additional specifications should
the need arise.

This patch provides the initial process documentation. It is loosely
based on reading many mailing list threads on specs, launchpad,
and on the latest updates to the Neutron RFE / spec template process [1].

[1] http://www.siliconloons.com/posts/2015-06-01-new-neutron-rfe-process/

Change-Id: I30a7f3d4ac13d1fb621c9bdd4001a1831f7c0d16
