commit_message:
Add breadcrumbs to final details pages

This patch adds the breadcrumb navigation to the final few details
pages: Users, Load Balancers, Projects, Hypervisors.

- Small redesigns the Load Balancer page to make the Member/Monitor
listings more readable
- Small redesign of Monitor Details to make Pools list more readable
- Adds missing translation wrapper to subnets breadcrumb

At this point, all Details pages should now use the breadcrumb format,
with the exception of Network Details, which is waiting on
https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1416838

Closes-Bug: 1413823
Closes-Bug: 1100318
Change-Id: I3a1de6d24dfd49ae2e28107e9de76bbd9d972162

Enhance test_metrics

Test more details in create metrics and list metrics.
Added timestamp_to_iso and timestamp_to_iso_millis functions in helpers.py
instead of using deprecated functions timeutils.iso8601_from_timestamp and timeutils.isotime.

Modify the exception handling in TOSCA Parser so that all possible
validation errors are captured during parsing (instead of stopping
the parsing when the first error is encountered) and reported when

Partially-Implements: blueprint tosca-tpl-cli-validator
'}]
commit_message:
Full validation of TOSCA templates

Modify the exception handling in TOSCA Parser so that all possible
validation errors are captured during parsing (instead of stopping
the parsing when the first error is encountered) and reported when
parsing is done.

Reporting the line number of each error will be implemented in a
separate patch.

Change-Id: I032c371fe0a73cdf901599ed4ae113f9157d8a1b
Partially-Implements: blueprint tosca-tpl-cli-validator

subject: Tidy engine and datasource mgr refer in harness
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-16 09:36:54.000000000', 'files': ['congress/api/datasource_model.py', 'congress/tests/api/test_driver_model.py', 'congress/api/status_model.py', 'congress/harness.py', 'congress/api/system/driver_model.py', 'congress/api/schema_model.py'], 'message': 'Tidy engine and datasource mgr refer in harness

The policy engine and datasource mgr instance are created in
harness.create(), they are transmited for all API model when
cage.createservice(), but not all API models need both of them,
tidy the object refer, only present in arguments when the API

Change-Id: Ic2d8e93d71d6e19e5f5fdad3ddc7928ec311de08
'}]
commit_message:
Tidy engine and datasource mgr refer in harness

The policy engine and datasource mgr instance are created in
harness.create(), they are transmited for all API model when
cage.createservice(), but not all API models need both of them,
tidy the object refer, only present in arguments when the API
model really need.

Change-Id: Ic2d8e93d71d6e19e5f5fdad3ddc7928ec311de08

commit_message:
Convert exceptions to MigrationPreCheckError

Exceptions returned during pre live migration should be
MigrationPreCheckError exceptions otherwise the instance will
be set to error state.

Change-Id: I231c2bacbe06072421073e92a9048bf97b263230
Closes-Bug: #1513643

The api endpoint '/test_runs' is not being used by any page. As of
today, getting all this data from the database at once will simply end

commit_message:
Remove '/test_runs' api endpoint

The api endpoint '/test_runs' is not being used by any page. As of
today, getting all this data from the database at once will simply end
up in a server error. Neither a browser nor the Apache server are ready
to handle this much data.
If we really want to have this, it will be better filtering it.

Change-Id: I3eee8b76e8a87c129592edce37cb199310a8cf1c

subject: Fixed bugs in dependency graph tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 15:54:06.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/datalog/test_compiler.py'], 'message': 'Fixed bugs in dependency graph tests

Previously we were using assertTrue when we should have
been using assertEqual, which meant the tests were not running.

Fortunately, the tests were broken but the code was not, since the
tests pass with the fix in place.

Change-Id: I6e26502462f752143c526c68c64d59ee0124f783
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed bugs in dependency graph tests

Previously we were using assertTrue when we should have
been using assertEqual, which meant the tests were not running.

Fortunately, the tests were broken but the code was not, since the
tests pass with the fix in place.

Change-Id: I6e26502462f752143c526c68c64d59ee0124f783

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-12 21:00:48.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': "WIP create_export only call when not attached

This patch changes how the volume manager calls create_export.
Currently the volume manager's initialize_connection always calls
create_export.   This should only be called when the volume isn't
already attached to the host.  There is no need to export the volume
if it's already attached.

Change-Id: I0637e57b1d3390c547a9745ce193a89c9459d1c0
TODO: create a bug for this?
"}]
commit_message:
WIP create_export only call when not attached

This patch changes how the volume manager calls create_export.
Currently the volume manager's initialize_connection always calls
create_export.   This should only be called when the volume isn't
already attached to the host.  There is no need to export the volume
if it's already attached.

Change-Id: I0637e57b1d3390c547a9745ce193a89c9459d1c0
TODO: create a bug for this?

it a second time is redundant.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-13 07:28:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': "Fix pci_stats logging in resource tracker

In the resource tracker the pci stats is show in
the log like pci_stats=PciDevicePoolList(objects=[PciDevicePool]
the patch fix it to be logged as
pci_stats=[PciDevicePool(count=7,numa_node=None,product_id='1004',
           tags={physical_network='physnet1'},vendor_id='15b3')]

Closes-Bug: #1513467
Change-Id: I9434bb5cf0ed9eca291df6f4a8b8568b7c3ff4eb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix pci_stats logging in resource tracker

In the resource tracker the pci stats is show in
the log like pci_stats=PciDevicePoolList(objects=[PciDevicePool]
the patch fix it to be logged as
pci_stats=[PciDevicePool(count=7,numa_node=None,product_id='1004',
           tags={physical_network='physnet1'},vendor_id='15b3')]

Closes-Bug: #1513467
Change-Id: I9434bb5cf0ed9eca291df6f4a8b8568b7c3ff4eb

commit_message:
Fuel plugin builder accepts 'master' as task role

Schema for all versions was updated to accept also 'master' string as
deployment task role, in addition to previous possible values:
'*' string and array of strings matching '^[0-9a-zA-Z_-]+$' regex.

Closes-bug: #1510354
DocImpact

Change-Id: Iaaf17bf42efb27beda23cf6a46137e380f8569c0

commit_message:
Add 'volume_type' parameter to instance create

Add an optional Cinder volume-type parameter to the instance
create command.
Also allow for 'volume_type' parameter in cluster create.

Change-Id: Ie36601e517156f20f95dfd6c4b6358d268cb4b80

'message': 'Drop Django 1.7 support

Django 1.7 support ends in December 2015
(https://www.djangoproject.com/download/#supported-versions), so it
will not be supported by Mitaka release.

This patch removes many of the deprecation warnings:-

`RedirectView.permanent` change:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/ref/class-based-views/base/

`url` change:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/internals/deprecation/
See version 1.5 notes for the url and ssi template tag change

`django.forms.utils` change:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/internals/deprecation/
See version 1.9 notes

`firstof` change:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/internals/deprecation/
See version 1.8 notes for cycle and firstof template tags

Change-Id: If546c087e73d189daa92e5bd63f0533fcf19089f
Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-dj17
'}]
commit_message:
Drop Django 1.7 support

Django 1.7 support ends in December 2015
(https://www.djangoproject.com/download/#supported-versions), so it
will not be supported by Mitaka release.

This patch removes many of the deprecation warnings:-

`RedirectView.permanent` change:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/ref/class-based-views/base/

`url` change:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/internals/deprecation/
See version 1.5 notes for the url and ssi template tag change

`django.forms.utils` change:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/internals/deprecation/
See version 1.9 notes

`firstof` change:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/internals/deprecation/
See version 1.8 notes for cycle and firstof template tags

Change-Id: If546c087e73d189daa92e5bd63f0533fcf19089f
Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-dj17

commit_message:
[Verify] Refactoring HtmlOutput

There is no reason to use OOP for one simple method. This patch replaces
class HtmlOutput with simple function "generate_report".

Also, it adds an improvement for skip reason: now ID of a bug is replaced
by the launchpad link to it in HTML report.

Change-Id: Ia75578a67a1fe626b80b877bbda659b5e6070ef0

commit_message:
Fix query param parsing

If falcon receives multiple query parameters with the same name, it
creates a list of values for that name. This checks for a list and
takes the first value (to match the java api's behavior)

Change-Id: I660846494d4d3bc24c2d870e9b88d0fd2fcc7fcf

subject: Fix PolicyException on restarting service
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-13 08:54:22.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datalog/compile.py'], 'message': 'Fix PolicyException on restarting service

Current behaviour allows to create two tables with multiple arities
if one of the arity is 0. But loading the same rules
on restarting the service fails. This commit is to fix the same.

Change-Id: I133532658c421d09640419cef7857cf5eaa864d9
Closes-Bug:#1515890
'}]
commit_message:
Fix PolicyException on restarting service

Current behaviour allows to create two tables with multiple arities
if one of the arity is 0. But loading the same rules
on restarting the service fails. This commit is to fix the same.

Change-Id: I133532658c421d09640419cef7857cf5eaa864d9
Closes-Bug:#1515890

commit_message:
Migrate to tempest_lib : exceptions

In order to be independent from changes in Tempest. Congress should
use the tempest_lib as much as possible. Exception classes are
already copied to tempest_lib.

Change-Id: I6c11acd96d5c508d8c84d612e7ce328e45f81549

commit_message:
Update neutron-debug to use stevedore aliases

Updating neutron-debug as it is importing interface driver classes
directly and not using the load_driver_interface method.
Also adds unit tests for the neutron-debug tool.

Change-Id: Icf095b2182225e63e85d849d83c2cb36b8a39217
Closes-Bug: #1504536
(cherry picked from commit c4e0574da1c7f30f9a153e01e7793926454cf2c7)

commit_message:
XenAPI:Fix problems to support xenserver+neutron

The lack of a CI for XenAPI + Neutron has meant this support has been
broken over time. This is set of one-off fixes that are needed to
reintroduce support while we work towards getting a CI functional

Related-Bug: #1495423
Change-Id: Id41fdc77c155756bda9e2e9ac0446a49f06f0603

commit_message:
Remove unused exceptions from glance

Based on this: I58e69ddced3ca7fad0a9df8c7f52f5f5c077a844 it turned
out that some of glance_store exceptions will never be generated.
Also it turns out that some glance exception are not raised any
where in code. So we can safely delete them from Glance.

Change-Id: I945bee4ceeec42065a78e2147f278b264c5217a2

Heat supports 'list_join' function to join one or more
lists of strings in Liberty release. But when we resolve
the function, we pop some arguments, this introduced
errors if resolve the snippet again when updating a resource.

This patch correct the behavior of 'list_join' function,
also refactor some codes for the functions of Kilo/Liberty.

Change-Id: Ia67a0171261ca1a864fe11f7d61c3bf5ef801040
Closes-Bug: #1513060
"}]
commit_message:
Correct list_join function

Heat supports 'list_join' function to join one or more
lists of strings in Liberty release. But when we resolve
the function, we pop some arguments, this introduced
errors if resolve the snippet again when updating a resource.

This patch correct the behavior of 'list_join' function,
also refactor some codes for the functions of Kilo/Liberty.

Change-Id: Ia67a0171261ca1a864fe11f7d61c3bf5ef801040
Closes-Bug: #1513060

commit_message:
enginefacade: 'certificate' and 'pci_device'

Use enginefacade in 'certificate' and 'pci_device' sections.

Hypervisor support matrix: define pause & unpause

Clarify in the hypervisor support matrix docs that "Stop instance CPUs"
is the same as "pause", and that "Resume instance CPUs" is the same as
"unpause".

Closes-Bug: #1511487

commit_message:
libvirt: support snapshots with parallels virt_type

It's not currently possible to create snapshots if you
use libvirt driver with parallels virt_type. First of all
it's because snapshot_extract method is not implemented
in imagebackend.Ploop class. There are also issues in
utils.extract_snapshot, find_disk and get_disk_type.

This patch solves all those issues, so snapshots will
work with parallels virt_type.

DocImpact: parallels now supports snapshot
Closes-bug: 1484074
Implements: blueprint ploop-snapshot-support

Change-Id: Id3b5bfc946a858f7e6ed710f2b44c7ca63a10723

commit_message:
Use oslo.config choices kwarg with StrOpt for servicegroup_driver

There are only three supported values for the servicegroup_driver option
as listed in the code and the help text of the option. We can enforce this
with the choices kwarg built into StrOpt so we don't need the explicit
KeyError checking in the code, a ValueError is raised if an invalid value
is specified in nova.conf.

Change-Id: Iaf419cc4f06e26bb0836661460883710df3c22e6

commit_message:
Fixed issue with 429 code for Tempest results

We fixed issue with TestRail API 429 errors for
SWARM tests, but for Tempest results we need to
use minimum API requests and upload all results
with only one bulk API request.

I sent support request to TestRail support team
and they provided me the information how we can
change our API calls to TestRail to avoid any
issues in the future.

Change-Id: I7d8ffc3238eefe186f9ec904d8dca153527261ab
Related-Bug: #1514797

commit_message:
Install 'dpkg-dev' before regenerating repository

Currently 'dpkg-scanpackages' tool is provided by 'dpkg-dev'
package (see bug #1515563), so it must be installed for
tests which regenerate Ubuntu repository on master node.

Change-Id: Ieb2968d428b098bdd5457dd298aebe0131562f26
Closes-bug: #1516662

revisions:
[{'number': 35, 'created': '2015-11-14 13:12:19.000000000', 'files': ['rally/verification/tempest/config.py', 'rally/verification/tempest/config.ini', 'tests/unit/verification/test_config.py'], 'message': '[Verify] Adding creation of network resources to Tempest context

Tempest creates private network resources for all tests by default.
If a cloud has some shared networks, many Tempest tests will fail with
the following error:

    "Multiple possible networks found."

To avoid this issue we have to configure the fixed_network_name option
in the Tempest config file. So this patch proposes the following solution:

    if the cloud doesn't have any shared networks, the default behavior
    defined in Tempest will be used and Tempest itself will manage network
    resources;

    if the cloud has some shared networks, we will create our own shared
    network and specify its name in the Tempest config file;

    if user configures the fixed_network_name option in the tempest.conf
    file manually, then we don't need to do anything.

Unit tests for new methods and missing unit tests were added.

Change-Id: I487806fe9a8ccd8528922cfaa2700df30961ef9b
'}]
commit_message:
[Verify] Adding creation of network resources to Tempest context

Tempest creates private network resources for all tests by default.
If a cloud has some shared networks, many Tempest tests will fail with
the following error:

    "Multiple possible networks found."

To avoid this issue we have to configure the fixed_network_name option
in the Tempest config file. So this patch proposes the following solution:

    if the cloud doesn't have any shared networks, the default behavior
    defined in Tempest will be used and Tempest itself will manage network
    resources;

    if the cloud has some shared networks, we will create our own shared
    network and specify its name in the Tempest config file;

    if user configures the fixed_network_name option in the tempest.conf
    file manually, then we don't need to do anything.

Unit tests for new methods and missing unit tests were added.

Change-Id: I487806fe9a8ccd8528922cfaa2700df30961ef9b

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-16 14:58:55.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_build_utils.py', 'fuel_agent/utils/build.py'], 'message': 'Remove cached debs from the image

debs cached by APT are useless after the chroot has been built,
remove them to make image smaller (=> faster provisioning).

Closes-Bug: #1514389

Change-Id: I5ca34ae3b540b1b63e4b0c1dc92b78da2442c1ee
'}]
commit_message:
Remove cached debs from the image

debs cached by APT are useless after the chroot has been built,
remove them to make image smaller (=> faster provisioning).

Closes-Bug: #1514389

Change-Id: I5ca34ae3b540b1b63e4b0c1dc92b78da2442c1ee

commit_message:
Extend list benchmarks for ceilometer

Existing benchmarks which process a list of resources and meters
are updated via new context and adding new configured query
parameters.

It allows to find a weak places in requesting ceilometer
data and extend count of scenarios which use a ceilometer.

Change-Id: Ifbb77915267f7e339ea7adbd9dae34ca59acb78d

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-11-13 01:46:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_sheepdog.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/sheepdog.py'], 'message': 'Sheepdog: Retrieve Config Info from specified group

The current sheepdogdriver simply gets Config Info from default
group of cinder config file, so we can run only one sheepdog cluster
as cinder backend. This patch fixes the problem by retrieving Config
Info from specified config group.

Change-Id: Icc8c8945bba0fcded83ff01e302b04a0e62c039f
Closes-Bug: #1514353
'}]
commit_message:
Sheepdog: Retrieve Config Info from specified group

The current sheepdogdriver simply gets Config Info from default
group of cinder config file, so we can run only one sheepdog cluster
as cinder backend. This patch fixes the problem by retrieving Config
Info from specified config group.

Change-Id: Icc8c8945bba0fcded83ff01e302b04a0e62c039f
Closes-Bug: #1514353

commit_message:
Remove unused scrub variables in barbican.conf

In /etc/barbican/barbican.conf, there are entries for a scrubber. There
are no scrubbers implemented for barbican so I am deleting the unused vars.

Change-Id: I61fe6a68a8155b261a20c85d7ef09be10a62151e

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-10-14 14:29:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fake_libvirt_utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_utils.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Don't attempt to convert initrd images.

Fetching kernel or initrd images used the same code
path as main images. This should not be the case as
these should never be resized, and should always be
in 'raw' format.

Kernel and inird images are now fetched directly

attempted resizes or conversions.

Change-Id: I9ab0391bb681185e8fe236698f5721d6cf25689b
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Don't attempt to convert initrd images.

Fetching kernel or initrd images used the same code
path as main images. This should not be the case as
these should never be resized, and should always be
in 'raw' format.

Kernel and inird images are now fetched directly
without any checks for types and bypassing any
attempted resizes or conversions.

Closes-Bug: #1497293
Change-Id: I9ab0391bb681185e8fe236698f5721d6cf25689b

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-11-13 16:04:45.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_rbd.py'], 'message': "Fix limited retype support for rbd

The limited support for retyping of rbd volumes fails due to the
way the characteristics of the two volume types are compared: it
is assumed that the 'diff' dictionary is empty if the two volume
types do not differ. 'diff', however, contains value tuples for
the QoS, encryption, and extra_specs keys, irrespective of whether
or not they differ between the two types.
The current patch loops over the keys in the 'diff' dictionary and
compares the tuples.

Change-Id: I2ca42cf1c6f1236240d1a4d5f3a311316264e4a2
Closes-Bug: #1514775
"}]
commit_message:
Fix limited retype support for rbd

The limited support for retyping of rbd volumes fails due to the
way the characteristics of the two volume types are compared: it
is assumed that the 'diff' dictionary is empty if the two volume
types do not differ. 'diff', however, contains value tuples for
the QoS, encryption, and extra_specs keys, irrespective of whether
or not they differ between the two types.
The current patch loops over the keys in the 'diff' dictionary and
compares the tuples.

Change-Id: I2ca42cf1c6f1236240d1a4d5f3a311316264e4a2
Closes-Bug: #1514775

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-07 18:29:53.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/vars/configs/haproxy_config.yml'], 'message': 'Fixed haproxy backend config issue

The change updates the haproxy configs to use backends with a
default of an empty array. This is needed to ensure that the backends
are not being assumed to have some value. In the current system if an
inventory item did not exist the rendered backend would be a jinja
string which would cause the haproxy play to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1513455

Change-Id: I221dbd910c75c2e41c98a33e1c38c7f69718b544
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed haproxy backend config issue

The change updates the haproxy configs to use backends with a
default of an empty array. This is needed to ensure that the backends
are not being assumed to have some value. In the current system if an
inventory item did not exist the rendered backend would be a jinja
string which would cause the haproxy play to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1513455

Change-Id: I221dbd910c75c2e41c98a33e1c38c7f69718b544
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Can not set auth_endpoint in runtime

In rumtime castellan should be able to set auth_endpoint using options.set_defaults()
which is critical for application to be able to adjust endpoint in runtime.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/castellan/+bug/1515388

Change-Id: Ie918dcc4d28ec3507559e1b0c218995f6809c364

commit_message:
Add reno for release notes management

Mostly cargo-culted from I9549e6b491b26232f4dac900b0bf05f10eb0e30a.

It modifies neutron.common.utils:replace_file(),

Change-Id: Id1a7f1236786e8606c91bb9925cd9ac8e95892b3
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to using neutron.common.utils:replace_file()

neutron.agent.linux.utils:replace_file() and
neutron.common.utils:replace_file() have same functionality.

This is the 1st patch in the series of 4 patches.
It modifies neutron.common.utils:replace_file(),
so it can be used by all components as a replacement
for neutron.agent.linux.utils:replace_file().
New keyword parameter 'file_mode=0o644' is added
to neutron.common.utils:replace_file().

Partial-bug: #1504477
Change-Id: Id1a7f1236786e8606c91bb9925cd9ac8e95892b3

commit_message:
Add documentation for keystone tokens

This serves as a very general introduction for keystone's token providers. We
can use this to link to other, more specific token documents.

Change-Id: I51a39c1830b9d9db5e4a7012a79fcc482537ebde

commit_message:
bump oslo.config upper-constraint

oslo.config 2.5.0 added support for more validation of options such as
enforcing type on ListOpts. gnocchi uses this feature so to allow proper
use and testing of gnocchi in gate, it'd be good to bump constraint

Change-Id: I97f538aafbbb2689b6714ab6fe1453c407ab4195

subject: liberty: release oslo.log 1.11.1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-28 19:20:33.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/liberty/oslo.log.yaml'], 'message': 'liberty: release oslo.log 1.11.1

This is to release 83dd60562fa79d31337e9b9ecec9264bc5b4d9dc which is the
stable/liberty backport that fixes bug 1499620.

The changes since 1.11.0 are:

mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/oslo.log$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.11.0..
e9aa188 Updated from global requirements
83dd605 Fix unintended assignment of "syslog"
f2f10a1 Updated from global requirements
0337395 Update .gitreview for stable/liberty

The two requirements updates should be OK to put out in a patch version
release of oslo.log since:

1. e9aa188 is excluding oslo.utils 2.6.0

2. f2f10a1 requires pbr>=1.6 which is the minimum version required for
   pbr in g-r stable/liberty.

Related-Bug: #1499620

Change-Id: I67ca9500eff5d902b13cd18eebcd7539ec8bbc44
'}]
commit_message:
liberty: release oslo.log 1.11.1

This is to release 83dd60562fa79d31337e9b9ecec9264bc5b4d9dc which is the
stable/liberty backport that fixes bug 1499620.

The changes since 1.11.0 are:

mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/oslo.log$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.11.0..
e9aa188 Updated from global requirements
83dd605 Fix unintended assignment of "syslog"
f2f10a1 Updated from global requirements
0337395 Update .gitreview for stable/liberty

The two requirements updates should be OK to put out in a patch version
release of oslo.log since:

1. e9aa188 is excluding oslo.utils 2.6.0

2. f2f10a1 requires pbr>=1.6 which is the minimum version required for
   pbr in g-r stable/liberty.

Related-Bug: #1499620

Change-Id: I67ca9500eff5d902b13cd18eebcd7539ec8bbc44

commit_message:
Refine event_log_formatter output

- Fix timestamp printing so that date is first, and time doesn't have
  truncated seconds
- Remove event UUID from output since it is of limited usefulness and
  causes clutter

Change-Id: I646be059546289b4131956ba050ec1f1f74ab3b9
Closes-Bug: #1516481

make the driver.Scheduler as abstract class

method select_destinations is the abstract method, every subclass
of Scheduler should override, so add abstractmethod decorator

Change-Id: Ib9edd7ac9fc024543efb0b878431fa8351c68a45

* Added “Action details” overview screen

Partially implements blueprint: Actions-screen-improvements
Closes-Bug: 1505659

commit_message:
Sync code from oslo incubator and fix imports

Sync common code from oslo incubator to make our stable/kilo branch be
compatible with dependencies for project.

Cherry-pick following commits from "stable/kilo" branch of oslo-incubator:
Idb68321, Ifab8a09, I408e14d, Ic0d4053, 0cc741a, 66bad01

Fix imports of oslo.utils and oslo.serialization.

Closes-Bug: #1480221

Change-Id: Ica2268649a855f2f1c6d6c7ceb21297d12094364

wrong service name. Also fixes list_containers() method.

commit_message:
cells is a sad panda about scheduler hints

The new test_schedule_to_all_nodes test fails in some epic ways in
cells. Not really worth debugging, this is a new test and had just
exposed another cells / devstack issue. Just skip the test.

Change-Id: Icc71e36f4ecb015dff9e806caacd31262f7e17f7

subject: Add oslo_config program support to paste middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 23:00:58.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/base.py', 'doc/source/cors.rst', 'doc/source/oslo_config.rst'], 'message': "Add oslo_config program support to paste middleware

oslo_config's configfile autodiscovery permits an additional parameter
named 'prog', which will add an additional file name to the possible
files that are checked in oslo_config directories. This patch adds this
parameter to paste-ini initialization, permitting access to more
configuration files.

This feature is required by glance, as glance does not make use of
./glance/glance.conf. Instead, they use ./glance/glance-api.conf. The
appropriate middleware configuration in this case would then be:

oslo_config_project=glance
oslog_config_program=glance-api

Change-Id: Ie530e4fac8076dc46b705770d12940ef91cb4644
"}]
commit_message:
Add oslo_config program support to paste middleware

oslo_config's configfile autodiscovery permits an additional parameter
named 'prog', which will add an additional file name to the possible
files that are checked in oslo_config directories. This patch adds this
parameter to paste-ini initialization, permitting access to more
configuration files.

This feature is required by glance, as glance does not make use of
./glance/glance.conf. Instead, they use ./glance/glance-api.conf. The
appropriate middleware configuration in this case would then be:

oslo_config_project=glance
oslog_config_program=glance-api

Change-Id: Ie530e4fac8076dc46b705770d12940ef91cb4644

[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-11-16 11:52:47.000000000', 'files': ['shotgun/test/test_config.py', 'shotgun/config.py', 'shotgun/test/test_driver.py', 'shotgun/settings.py', 'shotgun/driver.py', 'shotgun/manager.py', 'shotgun/test/test_manager.py'], 'message': "Skip offline nodes

Apparently, shotgun never tested which nodes are online
prior to execute snapshot method of objects. Therefore, for offline
nodes shotgun will then consume a lot of time waiting for connection
timeouts to be happened on per object basis.

This patch totally rework how shotgun handles the objects:
* objects being processed on per host basis
* on NetworkError, all affected objects on per host basis will be
  postponed for processing at the end of queue.
* if postponed objects still couldn't be proccessed on the last
  attempt, they will then be converted into offline objects.
* adds `Offline` object driver. Being snapshotted, this object just
  creates a file with friendly reminder that particular node was
  offline inside of snapshot target directory. So, one which's
  looking at snapshot archive will effectively realize that node
  was offline without deep diving into shotgun log file.

So, shotgun won't waste time or per object basis, as it was before.

Change-Id: Ib99476c7b67a04d4f472f3fa3803b3fb92d4fec4
Closes-Bug: #1397038

commit_message:
Skip offline nodes

Apparently, shotgun never tested which nodes are online
prior to execute snapshot method of objects. Therefore, for offline
nodes shotgun will then consume a lot of time waiting for connection
timeouts to be happened on per object basis.

This patch totally rework how shotgun handles the objects:
* objects being processed on per host basis
* on NetworkError, all affected objects on per host basis will be
  postponed for processing at the end of queue.
* if postponed objects still couldn't be proccessed on the last
  attempt, they will then be converted into offline objects.
* adds `Offline` object driver. Being snapshotted, this object just
  creates a file with friendly reminder that particular node was
  offline inside of snapshot target directory. So, one which's
  looking at snapshot archive will effectively realize that node
  was offline without deep diving into shotgun log file.

So, shotgun won't waste time or per object basis, as it was before.

Change-Id: Ib99476c7b67a04d4f472f3fa3803b3fb92d4fec4
Closes-Bug: #1397038

commit_message:
Explicitly disable vCenter certificate verification check

- nova-compute with enabled VCDriver by default tries to verify vCenter
  certificate, if it cannot verify certificate then it cannot start and
  operate normally.  This breaks deployment process for OpenStack
  clusters that use vCenter, because later in post deployment stage we
  cannot add nova-compute services to availability zone, because they
  failed to start.

Change-Id: Iac725db304aae9cd9da910f16d16d4054cc10542
Closes-bug: #1513832
DocImpact: Document the fact that currently it is not possible to
verify vCenter SSL certificate by providing CA certificate bundle.

subject: Make sure Facter is only executed on agent
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-12 22:59:39.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/glance_registry_paste_ini.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_api_paste_ini.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_cache_config.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_registry_config.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_api_config.rb'], 'message': 'Make sure Facter is only executed on agent

  This commit moves conditionals based on values obtained from Facter
  inside code blocks that are only executed on agents and replaces
  the use of Facter['osfamily'].value with Facter.value:(:osfamily).

  Without this change we are returning values based off the master's
  facts, so if a Debian agent checks into a RedHat master then the type
  is currently making a decision based off of RedHat and not the actual
  OS of the agent running the catalog.  Code ran outside blocks is
  evaluated on masters and inside a block is evaluated by the agent when
  the catalog is executed.  We do not notice this because all our
  testing uses "puppet apply" and autorequire only matters when they
  find a matching resource name in the catalog.  The latter results
  in no error because the relationship is simply ignored on the Debian
  agent if a package resource with the RedHat name is not found.

  This issue was found by running facter 3, the C++11 re-implementation
  under the jruby and clojure implemented puppetserver.  The clojure
  jni shim written so that facter can be ran inside of puppetserver does
  not implement the [] method for the Facter module but the ruby shim
  does.  So I noticed that the code had an issue when
  Facter['osfamily'].value was executed on the master, which returned a
  not method error.  Once again, something we didn't notice becuase we
  do not test against a master.  I decided to migrate to
  Facter.value(:osfamily) to simply keep to an API that is consistent
  across both puppet and puppetserver but fixing where the code runs
  does actually solve the not method found error.

Change-Id: I773f20e0bc1e917f6ec5fa8830f5bbfa60b6cd8a
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure Facter is only executed on agent

  This commit moves conditionals based on values obtained from Facter
  inside code blocks that are only executed on agents and replaces
  the use of Facter['osfamily'].value with Facter.value:(:osfamily).

  Without this change we are returning values based off the master's
  facts, so if a Debian agent checks into a RedHat master then the type
  is currently making a decision based off of RedHat and not the actual
  OS of the agent running the catalog.  Code ran outside blocks is
  evaluated on masters and inside a block is evaluated by the agent when
  the catalog is executed.  We do not notice this because all our
  testing uses "puppet apply" and autorequire only matters when they
  find a matching resource name in the catalog.  The latter results
  in no error because the relationship is simply ignored on the Debian
  agent if a package resource with the RedHat name is not found.

  This issue was found by running facter 3, the C++11 re-implementation
  under the jruby and clojure implemented puppetserver.  The clojure
  jni shim written so that facter can be ran inside of puppetserver does
  not implement the [] method for the Facter module but the ruby shim
  does.  So I noticed that the code had an issue when
  Facter['osfamily'].value was executed on the master, which returned a
  not method error.  Once again, something we didn't notice becuase we
  do not test against a master.  I decided to migrate to
  Facter.value(:osfamily) to simply keep to an API that is consistent
  across both puppet and puppetserver but fixing where the code runs
  does actually solve the not method found error.

Change-Id: I773f20e0bc1e917f6ec5fa8830f5bbfa60b6cd8a

commit_message:
[Verify] Fixing tokens expiration issue when deleting Tempest resources

The current cleanup mechanism for deleting Tempest resources after
the tests finished doesn't work properly. If Tempest tests take more
than 1 hour, we will not be able to delete a resource because of token
expiration. So this mechanism was slightly reworked to fix the issue.

Change-Id: I9807109e6cf7e5652c5fe73c433b7a9a8f3f489d

subject: Don't log exceptions redundantly
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7065, 'name': 'Brad P. Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11997, 'name': 'Lennart Regebro', 'email': 'lregebro@redhat.com', 'username': 'lregebro'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-20 21:43:34.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Don't log exceptions redundantly

The pattern

self.log.error('Some message')
self.log.exception(e)

is redundant and misuses the logging.exception function.  The
argument to exception() is supposed to be a string describing the
error that occurred, not the exception itself.  It already pulls
the exception details from the exception handler context and
includes them in the output.

This changes the instances of the above pattern to simply

self.log.exception('Some message')

which results in the correct output of something like:

ERROR:root:Some message
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./test.py", line 23, in <module>
    raise Exception('foo')
Exception: foo

Change-Id: Ia55ec34256ceb6f095c2fbfe2d085567f6382509
'}]
commit_message:
Don't log exceptions redundantly

The pattern

self.log.error('Some message')
self.log.exception(e)

is redundant and misuses the logging.exception function.  The
argument to exception() is supposed to be a string describing the
error that occurred, not the exception itself.  It already pulls
the exception details from the exception handler context and
includes them in the output.

This changes the instances of the above pattern to simply

self.log.exception('Some message')

which results in the correct output of something like:

ERROR:root:Some message
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./test.py", line 23, in <module>
    raise Exception('foo')
Exception: foo

Change-Id: Ia55ec34256ceb6f095c2fbfe2d085567f6382509

subject: Don't convert ValueError into NoSuchOptError in ConfigOpts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-14 05:28:30.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Don't convert ValueError into NoSuchOptError in ConfigOpts

In method __getattr__ of ConfigOpts, we catch all exceptions and convert
it to NoSuchOptError. This is wrong, we need allow raise ValueError to
provide more details about the error.
(cherry picked from commit 2576dd3eb139fe500567c8022429744903726a21)

Closes-Bug: #1507516
Change-Id: Ic08b812424ff9ad79f03a9069877b610fcbd4172
"}]
commit_message:
Don't convert ValueError into NoSuchOptError in ConfigOpts

In method __getattr__ of ConfigOpts, we catch all exceptions and convert
it to NoSuchOptError. This is wrong, we need allow raise ValueError to
provide more details about the error.
(cherry picked from commit 2576dd3eb139fe500567c8022429744903726a21)

Closes-Bug: #1507516
Change-Id: Ic08b812424ff9ad79f03a9069877b610fcbd4172

Change-Id: I8a05e341de80c2add418f22fa7f6f06349d378d6
'}]
commit_message:
Add environment for isolated networks without tunneling VLAN

This change introduces an environment file that includes isolated
networks but does not include a Tenant tunneling network. This is
for deployments where the tenant networking will be provided by
tenant VLANs, or provider networks, or another non-tunneling method.

Change-Id: I8a05e341de80c2add418f22fa7f6f06349d378d6

commit_message:
Support network isolation without external nets

This patch adds extra heat environments that can be used
to enable network isolation without using the external
network. Instead of a separate external network the ctlplane
will be used for all of the external/public traffic.

Change-Id: Ia542cee02121771d7d57ac701b62d7608e8d1855

commit_message:
Make CloudName available for Endpoints

CloudName is the DNS name for the public VIP this means we will likely
want it available for use in the endpoint hostnames, rather than people
needing to copy and paste the same hostname

Change-Id: Ic6d708b083244442195eee890de91bbc7e133ec2

Add serializer for delete_all_keys task

This task will delete all ssh keys and ssl certs for cluster when it's
reset, but first it needs a serializer.

commit_message:
Task for deleting ssh keys and ssl certs generated for deployment

This task will be called during cluster reset to make sure that there
will be new keys generated during next deployment of this env.

validating tasklib checks the graph to be connected, unless the task has
'detached' set to true, in which case it's not checked as part of
deployment graph.

Change-Id: I78203d0922316f02f08955f109c760aa45f8cd8d
Partial-bug: #1507361
Depends-On: I19e253b1ab21da1b556b36cf7d7bfb0b9205581a

commit_message:
Remove class_parameter_defaults puppet-lint check

commit_message:
Rename semantic-version dep to semantic_version

The package is actually named semantic_version, not semantic-version. This is
known to cause errors in old pip versions and with non standard setups,
so lets name it correctly.

Change-Id: I119d47afc8106cfe9a15e939cd1d425e8a1b2746

[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-11-13 19:46:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vm_util.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vif.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vif.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/constants.py'], 'message': "VMware: expand support for Opaque networks

The original support for Opaque networks make use of a
configuration flag indicating that a global integration bridge
was configured on the ESX host. If this global integration
bridge was used then that would be selected as the opaque network.

The next generation NSX neutron plugin will not make use of the
integration bridge. This will require that we make use of the network
ID for the opaque network.

The support for VC 6.0 has specific support for this. For 5.5 we make
use of a DynamicProperty setting to achieve the same goal.

DocImpact

For backward compatible opaque support the setting
'CONF.vmware.integration_bridge' needs to be set.

opaque id.

Change-Id: I309ca2bc8186b8eefc0a979d039dd4cd2a6f89f6
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: expand support for Opaque networks

The original support for Opaque networks make use of a
configuration flag indicating that a global integration bridge
was configured on the ESX host. If this global integration
bridge was used then that would be selected as the opaque network.

The next generation NSX neutron plugin will not make use of the
integration bridge. This will require that we make use of the network
ID for the opaque network.

The support for VC 6.0 has specific support for this. For 5.5 we make
use of a DynamicProperty setting to achieve the same goal.

DocImpact

For backward compatible opaque support the setting
'CONF.vmware.integration_bridge' needs to be set.
If this is not set then the network id will be used as the
opaque id.

In addition to this the default value has been set to 'None'.

Implements blueprint vmware-expand-opaque-support

Change-Id: I309ca2bc8186b8eefc0a979d039dd4cd2a6f89f6

commit_message:
Update startdash/startpanel for newer Django patterns

Django has transitioned to argparse for management commands, and this
patch migrates Horizon's commands to use the newer patterns.

Change-Id: Ib62286a92dd026d2e1224193a93f00846aa07fff
Closes-bug: #1496164

commit_message:
Rework service broker authorization process

Now we can use keystonemiddleware and murano context middleware for requests
from outside OpenStack so we don't need to recreate keystoneclient for each
request and can easily get token from the request headers. That makes
authorization proccess a lot easier in terms of source code.

Change-Id: If937501074b85d43921fdb108f8af3babeded828
Closes-Bug: #1512254

In order to workaround API limitations (such as

retries based on predefined error codes.

Try to resend request 3 times if '429' code is
received from API.

Closes-bug: #1514797
Change-Id: I723ef7886c86b7e418627962a1ff8aa7a4281c0a

commit_message:
Add retries to TestRail client

In order to workaround API limitations (such as
requests rate), adding mechanism of requests
retries based on predefined error codes.

Try to resend request 3 times if '429' code is
received from API.

Closes-bug: #1514797
Change-Id: I723ef7886c86b7e418627962a1ff8aa7a4281c0a
(cherry picked from commit 0debb2816160b27660449cf16561191e75539d82)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7173, 'name': 'Scott DAngelo', 'email': 'scott.dangelo@gmail.com', 'username': 'scottda'}, {'_account_id': 9171, 'name': 'Vipin Balachandran', 'email': 'vipin.bl@gmail.com', 'username': 'vbala'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12249, 'name': 'Scality CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@scality.com', 'username': 'scality-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15296, 'name': 'Brocade Openstack CI', 'email': 'Brocade-Openstack-CI@Brocade.com', 'username': 'Brocade-Openstack-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-16 11:08:36.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/service.py'], 'message': 'sqlalchemy exception kills FixedIntervalLoopingCall thread

Transient DB errors should not kill the thread for FixedIntervalLoopingCall.
This was noticed and fixed for the DBError case in Bug#1466991, but the
exception from sqlalchemy is not handled. Basically, self.model_disconnected
should be set to True, but the looping thread should carry on regardless of
the error.

Change-Id: I4bf04392269a2c33b77166b6c7408b38e1bc992d
Closes-Bug: #1478971
(cherry picked from commit c0f6a6e9e9b8713d12a02b8441c7616c24871526)
'}]
commit_message:
sqlalchemy exception kills FixedIntervalLoopingCall thread

Transient DB errors should not kill the thread for FixedIntervalLoopingCall.
This was noticed and fixed for the DBError case in Bug#1466991, but the
exception from sqlalchemy is not handled. Basically, self.model_disconnected
should be set to True, but the looping thread should carry on regardless of
the error.

Change-Id: I4bf04392269a2c33b77166b6c7408b38e1bc992d
Closes-Bug: #1478971
(cherry picked from commit c0f6a6e9e9b8713d12a02b8441c7616c24871526)

commit_message:
Support overriding of driver classpath in Spark jobs

It might be useful to have ability to override default value for cluster
of driver-class-path option for the particular job execution. The change
add new config option: "edp.spark.driver.classpath" that
can override driver-class-path for users' needs.

Implements blueprint: spark-override-classpath
Change-Id: I94055c2ccb70c953620b62ed18c27895c3588327

commit_message:
Report stack_status_reason on heat failure

When stack create fails, report the status reason, instead
of just the status. This gives the user useful information about
the cause of the failure (out of floating IPs, etc.) instead of
just "CREATE_FAILED".

Change-Id: Ibbaf14e8959cecfade98d13f8101e333eb76ee6e
Closes-Bug: 1516016

in api-paste.ini files, which was required by some of OpenStack
projects.

acpid 1.x used the deprecated /proc/acpi/event interface to listen for
ACPI events. In newer kernel releases that interface has been removed
and acpid made to use netlink instead, making the check always evaluate

commit_message:
Check the acpid version before starting the service

acpid 1.x used the deprecated /proc/acpi/event interface to listen for
ACPI events. In newer kernel releases that interface has been removed
and acpid made to use netlink instead, making the check always evaluate
to false on CentOS 7.

Change-Id: I7fb44c901fcaa9006e00c8bd77a2cca32219b4ed
Closes-bug: 1514817

commit_message:
Add hacking rule for "GET /resources"

This patch is a prototype for "GET /resources" hacking rule.
black_list_T110.txt file contains the service client files which
are against this rule. So we need to fix them with removing them
from this file.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I150fe2ef21d4d4d246a46d9baf2fb14cc7d79ee5

On the history Nova had two major API versions V2 and V3, and Tempest
contained the tests for both APIs with inheritances of test classes.
Then some classes contain _api_version and there are some base test
classes.
However V3 has been removed and now these base test classes and the

Change-Id: Icefb304a94492d92905cc425c442f10ebfe7d8b3
'}]
commit_message:
Remove BaseComputeTest and _api_version

On the history Nova had two major API versions V2 and V3, and Tempest
contained the tests for both APIs with inheritances of test classes.
Then some classes contain _api_version and there are some base test
classes.
However V3 has been removed and now these base test classes and the
_api_version are meaningless. So it is nice to remove for cleanup.

Change-Id: Icefb304a94492d92905cc425c442f10ebfe7d8b3

This makes parts of image-list, image-create and image-update backwards
compatable with v1. This is because we do not want to break peoples

commit_message:
Image backwards compatibility for v2

This makes parts of image-list, image-create and image-update backwards
compatable with v1. This is because we do not want to break peoples
stuff. So the default mode (no api specified) will just silently accept
these values.

This patch follows those guidelines, it will not show help for a
deprecated command and print to std error and if the api version is
specified this won't work.

I am following this:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/glance-backwards-compatibility for how
this should work.

This adds backwards compatibility for:
Image-List
--name
--status
--container-format
--disk-format
--is-public

Image-Create
--is-public
--is-protected

Image-update
--is-public
--is-protected
--human-readable

Change-Id: Ib2b164d94ea6a1a14c5a123bc66ba8356e96de2d

commit_message:
Fixed broken assignment to dictionary using integer key

The case

$dict[$key]: value

for integer $key was not addressed in LHS expression logic.
As a result no changes were made to $dict and no error was raised.

Change-Id: I969dab5f0d32312cf52490945934557c32f22dde
Closes-Bug: #1515612

Also modified the help message slightly to avoid mentioning dnsmasq

commit_message:
Move dhcp_lease_duration into DHCP agent config options list

It is DHCP agent specific, and so it should not be present in
neutron.conf or be reported as a valid option for other services.

Also modified the help message slightly to avoid mentioning dnsmasq
since the option could in theory be used by alternative dhcp drivers.

Change-Id: I66bcea1c3a6ce6fa9ce56ea8137a94858f18dc5a

subject: Fix issue with system installed xtrabackup
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-05 13:09:46.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/galera_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_client/tasks/galera_client_install.yml'], 'message': 'Fix issue with system installed xtrabackup

The change adds a task to ensure that the system provided
xtrabackup package is removed before installing the downloaded
version using the deb. This is required to ensure that there
are no version conflicts when installing the package.

The change also corrects the version of the galera server repo
in the defaults directory. While the repo correct version of
mariadb is being installed the name of the assumed repo is wrong.

Closes-Bug: #1513459

Change-Id: I63cb546cf5a4386320f01ed6f2120dd7c8341335
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with system installed xtrabackup

The change adds a task to ensure that the system provided
xtrabackup package is removed before installing the downloaded
version using the deb. This is required to ensure that there
are no version conflicts when installing the package.

The change also corrects the version of the galera server repo
in the defaults directory. While the repo correct version of
mariadb is being installed the name of the assumed repo is wrong.

Closes-Bug: #1513459

Change-Id: I63cb546cf5a4386320f01ed6f2120dd7c8341335
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

This change adds a new job to ironic-inspector using IPA for both

commit_message:
Add IPA-based job for ironic-inspector

IPA (ironic-python-agent) is a new default ramdisk for ironic,
replacing old bash-based ramdisks in diskimage-builder.

This change adds a new job to ironic-inspector using IPA for both
deploy and inspection. Old job now has -dib postfix to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: I0108f432872d84a40203153a592e11a697da1e68

commit_message:
Use skip_checks for live-migration feature in test

flag compute_feature_enabled.live_migration is class-wide,
so it make sense to use skip_checks method for class, instead
of decorating each test with skipIf, skipUnless, etc.

Change-Id: I62006b7e636b1773f4f41709cfec1fd6daae3c4f

subject: Add missing constraints in yum_update.sh
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-11 21:31:40.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': "Add missing constraints in yum_update.sh

Some missing pacemaker constraints were added in the following commits:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219770/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219665/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218931/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218930/

Overclouds that were deployed prior to these constraints being added to
tripleo-heat-templates still have the constraints missing. During an
update, stopping and starting the cluster can fail without these
constraints in place.  As a workaround, conditionally add these
contraints in yum_update.sh so that we're sure they're always present
before updating.

Change-Id: Id46c85dbbe5e85d362279661091b17ce1b697fe0
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing constraints in yum_update.sh

Some missing pacemaker constraints were added in the following commits:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219770/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219665/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218931/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218930/

Overclouds that were deployed prior to these constraints being added to
tripleo-heat-templates still have the constraints missing. During an
update, stopping and starting the cluster can fail without these
constraints in place.  As a workaround, conditionally add these
contraints in yum_update.sh so that we're sure they're always present
before updating.

Change-Id: Id46c85dbbe5e85d362279661091b17ce1b697fe0

subject: Set start/stop pacemaker resource timeouts for updates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 14:16:01.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': "Set start/stop pacemaker resource timeouts for updates

This matches change I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba, but we
need it to set it before attempting the cluster stop - yum update -
cluster start cycle, to make sure this cycle doesn't hit the low timeout
limits.

This can be removed once updates from deployments made prior to
I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba are no longer supported.

Change-Id: I587136d8d045d213875c657ea5a405074f80c8ad
"}]
commit_message:
Set start/stop pacemaker resource timeouts for updates

This matches change I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba, but we
need it to set it before attempting the cluster stop - yum update -
cluster start cycle, to make sure this cycle doesn't hit the low timeout
limits.

This can be removed once updates from deployments made prior to
I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba are no longer supported.

Change-Id: I587136d8d045d213875c657ea5a405074f80c8ad

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 14:02:36.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'Bump further the stop/start timeout for pcmk/systemd services

services so that it matches the 100s default set in future pcmk

commit_message:
Bump further the stop/start timeout for pcmk/systemd services

This bumps further up the stop/start timeout for the pcmk/systemd
services so that it matches the 100s default set in future pcmk
versions [1].

1. https://github.com/ClusterLabs/pacemaker/commit/17d65e9f44061a4fa14a9cddd6edc403b2d6d2b3

Change-Id: I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba

subject: Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-16 00:22:16.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override


Change-Id: If054a295dc58636bd317491e0f6cd454d1821a3e"}]
commit_message:
Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override


Change-Id: If054a295dc58636bd317491e0f6cd454d1821a3e

commit_message:
Fix docker.io bug in the Install Guide

Currently the Install Guide section regarding CoreOS images
and how to build them names the "docker" service "docker.io",
which is wrong. This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: Ie5837cae013d0c5595c9ba992a60bcd3ca1bc0e0
Closes-Bug: #1515283

commit_message:
Add mistral-specs

After discussion with Mistral core team, we decided to adopt the
specification approval process, like other official projects. Please see
the dependent patch in governance repo.

Change-Id: I6e273a854d35bf8179a4306800de78d574ae2da4
Depends-on: I7da1ffaee454383704beb94b0c2bc9786dd1846f

subject: Limit project-config-gerrit
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-13 13:49:25.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Limit project-config-gerrit

In only 10 % of commits a file in gerrit/acls/ is changed, so limit
project-config-gerrit to run only if one of the files gets changed
that it tests or uses.

Change-Id: I16101a47c2720d8b734db1cabec9069c0838d4cd
'}]
commit_message:
Limit project-config-gerrit

In only 10 % of commits a file in gerrit/acls/ is changed, so limit
project-config-gerrit to run only if one of the files gets changed
that it tests or uses.

Change-Id: I16101a47c2720d8b734db1cabec9069c0838d4cd

Separate method for validation custom repo settings added to
AttributesVAlidator class. Now validation checks repos in flat format.

subject: Limit run on gate-project-config-jenkins-project
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-12 05:50:32.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Limit run on gate-project-config-jenkins-project

Run this job only if one of the files that this uses changes.

Out of the last 200 commits, only 66 changed
jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml, so this limit only runs the test
in 33 % of submissions.

Change-Id: I4437096da0cf2cab478b5796c8c62a0178fef3ae
'}]
commit_message:
Limit run on gate-project-config-jenkins-project

Run this job only if one of the files that this uses changes.

Out of the last 200 commits, only 66 changed
jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml, so this limit only runs the test
in 33 % of submissions.

Change-Id: I4437096da0cf2cab478b5796c8c62a0178fef3ae

subject: Publish draft releasenotes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-15 20:09:07.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/openstack-publish-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Publish draft releasenotes

Upload the generated draft releasenotes so that they can be easily
reviewed - similar to documents with just clicking on the gate.

Rename the job to gate-{name}-releasenotes, the tox is not needed
anymore in the name.

Change-Id: Ib542084a275a5bfe82c48517d48372fec6411e16
'}]
commit_message:
Publish draft releasenotes

Upload the generated draft releasenotes so that they can be easily
reviewed - similar to documents with just clicking on the gate.

Rename the job to gate-{name}-releasenotes, the tox is not needed
anymore in the name.

Change-Id: Ib542084a275a5bfe82c48517d48372fec6411e16

commit_message:
Remove verbose code for hive metastore schema creation in MapR plugin

Use a property datanucleus.autoCreateSchema which creates schema on
startup if one does not exist.

Change-Id: I08421aae16cbddd810557734b680d986018b9139

commit_message:
Run py34 first in default tox run

this avoids py34 failure in default tox run when testrepository is
not yet initialized (e.g. fresh repo clone).

Change-Id: I7aa1817cfac3a60e6faabd1b21be736857b4c103
Closes-Bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Adding autogenerated saharaclient API docs

Saharaclient API docs now can be autogenerated, that
prevents them from manual update. Also docstrings
were added to describe some unclear parameters.

Make python34 job voting for muranoclient

implemented in master

Targets blueprint: client-py34-support

commit_message:
Rename get_job_status to get_job_info in oozie.py

get_job_status actually get job's info in oozie.py, rename it to
get_job_info to avoid the confusion.

Change-Id: I0628bcd0760b45e8345027f4dbd1e6c5d7c6e9fd
Closes-bug: 1515706

commit_message:
ES6size app.js

app.js now mostly uses ES6 syntax. This commit also moves
initialization of the app to a separate method and removes
a hack for ajax callbacks - we don't need it anymore.

Change-Id: Iba48469d195601e6bf450f1d33ba1db4a9a666bc

commit_message:
Pick up Lock Breaker from TODO items

Work items:
- Add a function to check engine status,
  and a timeout option in config.
- Add steal operation for lock_acquire.

Reference:
[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/senlin/+spec/lock-breaker
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/senlin/+bug/1514742

Change-Id: I1dbb3068496465a9c84810a819a9bdac43f9272b

The package python2-PyMySQL doesn't exist:

=========================

Closes-Bug: #1514248
"}]
commit_message:
Sql database in installation guide with wrong python package name

The package python2-PyMySQL doesn't exist:

controller:root:/etc/glance> yum search python2-PyMySQL
Loaded plugins: fastestmirror
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
 * base: centos1.hti.pl
 * epel: ftp.pbone.net
 * extras: centos1.hti.pl
 * updates: centos1.hti.pl
Warning: No matches found for: python2-PyMySQL
No matches found
2015-11-08 22:09:47 yum search python2-PyMySQL

However the package specified in the Kilo doc exists:

controller:root:/etc/glance> yum search MySQL-python
Loaded plugins: fastestmirror
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
 * base: centos1.hti.pl
 * epel: ftp.pbone.net
 * extras: centos1.hti.pl
 * updates: centos1.hti.pl
===========================================
=========================
N/S matched: MySQL-python ================
===========================================
=========
MySQL-python.x86_64 : An interface to MySQL

Change-Id: I5646325abc4914c95aa72902b6ea130ef31ded1a
Closes-Bug: #1514248

commit_message:
DRAFT Sync UI and Templated Networking

Ironic integration requires adding an optional network role and network.

Let's discuss how can this be achieved in the current state of the art
in Fuel and its Templated Networking feature.

Specifies blueprint sync-ui-and-templated-networking

Change-Id: Id84a6215652d9f83838861bb7bfb38a1dcdfc482

subject: Move the content of CONTRIBUTING.rst to doc/source
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-13 09:46:27.000000000', 'files': ['CONTRIBUTING.rst', 'doc/source/contributing.rst', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/CONTRIBUTING.rst'], 'message': 'Move the content of CONTRIBUTING.rst to doc/source

When using cross reference across docs, it is easy to
handle them if the document itself in doc/source.
Otherwise, if we see CONTRIBUTING.rst in the top directory
directly, we cannot follow sphinx references.

Change-Id: I96b6cd24dcbf16e3923e4bc6fe4069d692e75993
'}]
commit_message:
Move the content of CONTRIBUTING.rst to doc/source

When using cross reference across docs, it is easy to
handle them if the document itself in doc/source.
Otherwise, if we see CONTRIBUTING.rst in the top directory
directly, we cannot follow sphinx references.

Change-Id: I96b6cd24dcbf16e3923e4bc6fe4069d692e75993

commit_message:
This commit is for testing purpose. To confirm
microversion related changes with one of reviewer.
Please ignore it.

Change-Id: Icf1e463c2e3ebb50c38199bc5c690af715a2147e

Attr "is_public" can not be set for share using API "manage"

This fix allows manila-manage command to explicitly
set visibility (key '--public') similar to using API
"create".

Change-Id: Ia19a1373013ef699e2b953aa2c61d4ac2b89d41d
Closes-Bug: #1436865

commit_message:
Attr "is_public" can not be set for share using API "manage"

This fix allows manila-manage command to explicitly
set visibility (key '--public') similar to using API
"create".

Change-Id: I747e5fae6119d8cb619e9be8d832cb4a22b6a192

commit_message:
Attr "is_public" can not be set for share using API "manage"

This fix allows manila-manage command to explicitly
set visibility (key '--public') similar to using API
"create".

Change-Id: I39705acbfca844b66d74fbd2fee228a7a85bc2d9
Closes-Bug: #1436865

We defined API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS as core Nova APIs.
If these core APIs are not loaded, the boot of nova-api failed.
However, now defcore team is trying to define core APIs and it is
not necessary to define them in Nova itself. In addition, we will
remove API extensions in long term. So now API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS
becomes meaningless.
This patch removes API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS for avoiding confusions
related to the API extensions.

Change-Id: I84ab02801c19aa3bf9509ff748f40716566ee9ff
'}]
commit_message:
Remove API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS from v2.1 API

We defined API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS as core Nova APIs.
If these core APIs are not loaded, the boot of nova-api failed.
However, now defcore team is trying to define core APIs and it is
not necessary to define them in Nova itself. In addition, we will
remove API extensions in long term. So now API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS
becomes meaningless.
This patch removes API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS for avoiding confusions
related to the API extensions.

Change-Id: I84ab02801c19aa3bf9509ff748f40716566ee9ff

commit_message:
Use stevedore entry point instead of module path for interface driver

This is a preparation to move the interface driver from neutron
to our repository.

Related-Bug: #1510826
Change-Id: I3d9c7eeef8a34f75d8fcf40ac187a9d4da92f807
(cherry picked from commit ecfbd45f6c893697e6f35a402920250d2c5c7c23)

subject: Disable resize tests in Tempest if using cells with custom flavors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-06 18:28:04.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': "Disable resize tests in Tempest if using cells with custom flavors

By default, devstack creates it's own test flavors for Tempest runs.

These are not in the cells API database since they are non-default
for nova so any resize tests in Tempest with cells and these custom
flavors fail.

Configure Tempest to not run resize tests if using cells and custom
flavors.

This allows us to also clean up a bunch of the resize skips found
in nova/devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc.

Change-Id: I20f46024e45e32c60275703a193a56ae8cfe7eca
Closes-Bug: #1513925
"}]
commit_message:
Disable resize tests in Tempest if using cells with custom flavors

By default, devstack creates it's own test flavors for Tempest runs.

These are not in the cells API database since they are non-default
for nova so any resize tests in Tempest with cells and these custom
flavors fail.

Configure Tempest to not run resize tests if using cells and custom
flavors.

This allows us to also clean up a bunch of the resize skips found
in nova/devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc.

Change-Id: I20f46024e45e32c60275703a193a56ae8cfe7eca
Closes-Bug: #1513925
